story:
We Grow Together

Help us as we get ready to embark on our biggest journey yet.  We are planning on launching our non-profit "The Depot Cares"! From the very beginning we have had a heart for the community and now we want to do our part by bringing the arts to the youth and young adults in our inner cities.  But we can't do this without you. 

Here are the details:

  • We are trying to raise $10,000 to kick-off our non-profit.  We will be purchasing materials needed to start building art workshops, as well as book venues for these events.  It will also go towards legal fees, copyrights, and other essentials to establish The Depot Cares as a solid non-profit. 
  • We have amazing perks available for everyone who partners with us! Our favorite is the VIP pass where you can essentially attend every Depot event for the next year for FREE!

#StopTheHungerChallenge

In addition to the fundraiser, we are also participating in #StopTheHungerChallenge.  For over a billion people world-wide $1.50 is all they have to spend on food a day.  As an organization we are committing to saving $1.50 per team member for the next month and using that money to purchase food for those in need. That's equivalent to 150 bags of groceries!  We invite you to also join us in this challenge.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign by using one of the social media share links. 
  • Participate in the #StopTheHungerChallenge
  • Tell all of your friends and family. 

Thank you so much for your time and for partnering with us on this exciting new journey!

story:
What is this New Mobile App Entertainment Network?

This NEW & INNOVATIVE App Entertainment Network will bring positive programming to over 5.6 billion users cell phones and mobile devices worldwide. 

Similar to a traditional television network yet instead for mobile devices worldwide, this network will feature shows, music, books, magazines and games.

Initial funding will begin at $1,000 then as Amar releases this news via press conference at The W Hotel in Hollywood, funding will step up to $8,000, $20,000, $300,000 and beyond $1,000,000 by 2013.         

This network is a collective.  Each donation will count as a Production credit and donators will be listed with SAG-AFTRA One Union. sagaftra.org.  Listing will include: Associate Producer, Producer and Executive Producer. 

All currency collected by this campaign will go towards administrative cost to build this network.

 

Who is Amar Taborn?

Amar Taborn is a Hollywood Radio Personality, a show host and Executive Producer.  He has been on "The Love We World Tour 2012" traveling the United States and soon the world interviewing people to discover all forms of love.

This campaign is very important to Amar because he is dedicated to bringing positive media, art and programming to the world.  He vows that he will continue the legacy that Oprah Winfrey started add a Facebook flare and some Michael Jackson funk.

Contributions are greatly appreciated as Amar builds this innovative network, and continues to spread the message of love worldwide. 

 

The Impact

Amar thinks television is a dying industry and Mobile technology including Tablets and Cell Phones will take over within a few years as primary source of entertainment.  Currently there are more Smart Phones within the world than Televisions. 5.8 billion by 2016.

 

The mission of the Network

 

Innovative Entertainment

While on the United States Leg of this Love We Tour, Amar experimented with a new form of a talk show.  One that would invite the audience to be interactive while engaging with others worldwide via their mobile devices. This interactivity has the potential to attract not only viewers also advertisers that are seeking a new cost effective way to reach their market. 

WATCH EXPERIMENT

  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can make a difference.

  • Submit your Show or Show idea
  • Share this Campaign with your friends and family
  • Listen to Amar Taborn on the radio at www.gvbradio.com
  • Become a Paid Fundraiser 
  • Be kind and loving to other
  • Love We. 

 For more information contact: mramartaborn@gmail.com

 

PERKS

"Free Food" Vegetable Lasagna

Receive Amar's favorite homemade dishes for your contribution.  Delivered fresh next day and enough to share with friends and family.  Makes a great holiday gift.

S&H Additional . International shipping restrictions apply.

 

Love We Royal Carribean Cruise Retreats

Relaxing Carribean get away for two at a upcoming Love We World Tour Show.  

 

Fly to Los Angeles to be a guest on a Network Show

Airline tickets to a upcoming event in Los Angeles, California. 

 

 

 

GET YOUR PASSPORT

 

THIS PERK TO UNLOCKS

EVEN MORE PERKS

story:
Short Summary:

I'm Halsey Berryman, a junior Fine Arts undergraduate student at the Corcoran College of Art + Design in Washington, DC. Our small but diverse student body consists of artists who work across multiple disciplines, including sculpture, painting, drawing, multi-media, and performance. After working hard all year, twenty-four of my classmates and I have been selected to participate in a group show at the Brera Academy, located in Milan, Italy. 

Here's the problem: being such a small institution, we don't have the funds to support the shipping costs of safely transporting these works overseas.

The exhibition is a huge opportunity for all of us. For many of us, this is the first major show we will have been in, let alone internationally. Not only that, but the works included in this show have a chance of being entered into the Milan Expo of 2015. 

Students from the Brera Academy in Milan will be sending works to be exhibited in the Corcoran's own Gallery 31 in return. This is the first time the Corcoran has had the opportunity to exchange works with such an internationally reputable institution.

 

What We Need 

As of right now, we need $2500 to cover the rest of the shipping costs not funded by our institution. This would cover the boxes, insulation, and other safety precautions we would need to ship the works safely. Given the diversity of our selected students, some works will be more expensive to ship than others. 

If we don't reach our goal, all the funds from this campaign will go to shipping costs, regardless. We are confident that we can make this happen, but we need your help!

story:
Krátke info

Ahojte. Som absolvent Vysokej školy výtvarných umení v Bratislave. Moja teoretická

diplomová práca je kniha o historickom vývoji surferskej kultúry.

Táto exotická téma je velmi špecifická pre oblasť východnej Európy, preto potrebujem

vašu pomoc.

 

Spracovanie knihy bude netradičné. Obsahuje textové stránky, ale aj stránky obrázkové,

ktoré si budete môcť z knihy vybrať. Ak ste nadšencami surferskej kultúry, tak táto

kniha, plná farieb, textov a plagátov si musí nájsť miesto aj vo vašej knižnici.

 

Čo potrebujem a čo vám môžem dať?

Potrebujem finančnú podoporu na papier, tlač a realizáciu knihy o surferskej kultúre
 
v slovenskom jazyku. Všetky peniaze budú použité na realizáciu knihy.
 
Túto knihu vám budem môcť zaslať poštou alebo si ju prídete zobrať na krst, ktorý sa
 
uskutoční 15/7/2013 v KC Dunaj v Bratislave alebo v neskoršom termíne v Prahe.
 

 

Pozor!

Obrázky v galérii majú len informačný charakter a nezodpovedajú výslednej podobe

knihy. V skutočnosti bude ešte krajšia :)

story:
Update, 4-18-16: Hey, folks! We're less than two weeks to the end of the Tarot of Bones Spring 2016 IndieGoGo Campaign, and there's still almost $2,000 to go to hi the fundraising goal! Remember that if we don't achieve the $5,000 mark, IndieGoGo will take a much larger percentage of the final amount, in addition to what Paypal takes, which means significantly less funding to defray printing and other costs. The Tarot of Bones will still be released this year, but to help sweeten the pot a bit I'm announcing a stretch goal: if we achieve the $5,000 mark by the end of the campaign on April 30, I'll offer an online tutorial on how to use the Tarot of Bones exclusively for backers of the campaign. I already have one for those who backed the first campaign, so this will be a separate class at a different time. Those who are unable to make it to the class will get the video emailed to them. (And, of course, email advice is free!) Sound good? You can back the campaign here!


The Bones Are In Place; Let's Bring Them Home!

I'm Lupa, an artist, author and amateur naturalist in Portland, OR.; you can find out more about my works at my primary website. The Tarot of Bones is my biggest art and writing project yet: 78 assemblage pieces, one for each of the cards of the tarot, which will be photographed for a deck and book set to be released this summer. You can get more information about the Tarot of Bones on the official website.

I began this project in January 2015; since its inception, here's what I've accomplished:

  • I created all 78 permanent assemblage pieces, plus a 79th for the Happy Squirrel card, before my deadline of December 31, 2015.
  • I wrote the manuscript for the Tarot of Bones book, and delivered it to an independent editor for editing on December 31, 2015. I am now working on revising the manuscript using the edits I received.
  • I ran a highly successful IndieGoGo campaign to raise the funds needed to cover the substantial materials costs for the assemblages, among other expenses associated with this project.
  • I created a solid promotional campaign for the Tarot of Bones, to include multiple podcast, blog and other media interviews, social media networking, promotional postcards, and grassroots support throughout several communities relevant to this project.
  • I stayed within my production schedule with minimal alterations, and am still on course for a Summer 2016 release

Now I'm giving you a second opportunity to support the completion of the Tarot of Bones with the 2016 Campaign.


Why a Second Campaign?

Even though the first campaign ran for 45 days, I had a LOT of people tell me they missed out on the opportunity to back it, either because they didn't have the money at the time or didn't find out about it until later. This second campaign offers them a chance to pitch in and get the deck and book at a reduced rate (though not as low as in the first campaign). 

The initial Tarot of Bones IndieGoGo campaign raised a little over twice its $5,000 fundraising goal, an incredible outcome! After IndieGoGo and Paypal each took out their fees, I was able to:

  • Pay for the thousands of dollars of bones and other materials necessary to create the assemblages, which you can see on the Tarot of Bones website here
  • Order copies of my other books and other items that were selected as perks by campaign supporters
  • Print professional quality flyers and other promotional materials
  • Reserve funds to pay a professional editor for the Tarot of Bones companion book
  • Cover other administrative costs

I still have some of the funding left, and it will help defray remaining costs like shipping out the perks from the first campaign once the deck and book are out, but there are still significant outlays of money ahead including (but not limited to):

  • Printing an initial run of 2000 Tarot of Bones decks
  • Printing the 250+ preordered copies of the Tarot of Bones book through CreateSpace, plus those preordered during this IndieGoGo campaign
  • Shipping the decks and books from the printers to my home
And that's not including the fulfillment of perks for this campaign, official release parties to display the original assemblages before they're shipped to their new homes or put up for sale, and numerous other associated costs. 

$5,000 is not enough to cover all the above expenses, but it will make a healthy dent in them. The IndieGoGo campaigns are not the only source of funding for the project; I am putting a significant amount of my own money into the pot, no small feat given that I am 100% self-employed and the financial backbone of my household. I am not taking any of the IndieGoGo money for personal expenses like rent and bills, and putting hundreds of as-of-yet unpaid hours into the Tarot of Bones, so every dollar raised in this campaign helps ease the financial stress on my household.

What Do You Get For Your Contribution?

This time around, you can select perk packages that don't necessarily include the deck and book--this is so folks who supported the first campaign (and thereby reserved the deck and book already) can pick out even more goodies if they like. If you want to get more than one perk package you'll need to make separate contributions, but nothing's stopping you from doing just that!

So what sorts of goodies can you get by backing this campaign? Here are a few possibilities for you to choose from:

  • The Tarot of Bones Deck (with the companion paperback or ebook)
  • Prints of select cards, approximately 8" x 10" in size
  • A hand-sewn (by me!) leather bag to keep your deck in
  • Original assemblage pieces used in the making of the Tarot of Bones
  • Jewelry made from the jaws of skulls used in Tarot of Bones assemblages
  • T-shirts featuring art from the Tarot of Bones deck
  • Copies of my other books, your choice of which one(s)
  • A ten-card reading by me once I have my own copy of the Tarot of Bones
  • A special thank you in the Tarot of Bones companion book and on the official website

If you can't decide which one you reallllly want, keep in mind you can claim multiple perks by making multiple contributions.

Also, please remember that perk amounts include my costs for materials for fulfilling and shipping them, and also account for IndieGoGo and Paypal taking out their fees!

Now for a little more detail on some of these perks:

The Tarot of Bones Deck and Book: This is the primary reason for all this effort! You can choose from the deck alone, or the book and deck together. They are offered at a discount (though not quite as big a discount as in the first campaign, especially considering IndieGoGo now allows shipping to be added in). A great deal, and a great way to help me raise the funds to get the printing done!

Shirts: I'll be printing up t-shirts featuring the final photograph (without text) for the Magician card; the photo above just shows a prototype using my photo to test the print quality (looks even better in person!) The t-shirt perk is offered as a standalone, no cards or book included (you can always make another contribution if you want the deck and book!)

Prints: I'll be making prints of three NEW pieces! In the last campaign I offered the Ace of Pentacles, the Magician and Judgment. This time around you have your choice of the Empress (shown between the first and second sections of this page), the Two of Pentacles (at the top of this paragraph) and the Hierophant (at the beginning of Timeline, Risks and Challenges).

Leather Pouch: Leather pouches were one of the first projects I learned to make when I initially started working with hides and bones. You can choose to claim a deck with a leather pouch made just the right size for it. US folks will get one made of deerskin; international folks will get cowhide due to customs restrictions. Pouches will be shipped when the decks are shipped in Summer 2016.

Original Tarot of Bones Assemblage Piece: There are three different options for people in the U.S. who want to buy one of the original assemblage pieces used in making the Tarot of Bones. There is an additional option for international buyers to get one of a very limited number of the assemblage pieces that do not include wildlife or plant parts and can therefore be sent out of the U.S. While I will ultimately choose who gets which piece, you are welcome to contact me with your five favorites (you can see all the assemblages at www.thetarotofbones.com/the-cards). Also, as I will be displaying some of these originals at galleries and other art venues in the latter half of 2016, they will not be delivered to their new homes until sometime in 2017. (You will get your deck and book set plus any other perks in Summer 2016.)


Books: I've written and published several books prior to this project. You can choose to bring home one or more of these titles, shipped along with your Tarot of Bones set in Summer 2016:

Fang and Fur, Blood and Bone: A Primal Guide to Animal Magic

DIY Totemism: Your Personal Guide to Animal Totems

Skin Spirits: The Spiritual and Magical Uses of Animal Parts

New Paths to Animal Totems: Three Alternative Approaches to Creating Your Own Totemism

Plant and Fungus Totems: Connect With Spirits of Field, Forest and Garden

Nature Spirituality From the Ground Up: Connect With Totems in Your Bioregion

Please note that my anthologies are not included in this special offer. 

Limited Edition Jawbone Jewelry: I have a very small number of jawbones left over from skulls that were used in the creation of the Tarot of Bones assemblages. You can choose one of these exclusive pieces--made custom just for you--as a standalone perk (if you want the deck and book you'll need to make a separate contribution.)

Ten-card Reading: Once I have my own copy of the Tarot of Bones deck, I'll be giving people who choose this perk a ten card reading using the classic Celtic Cross spread. I have almost two decades of divination experience, and immersing myself in this project has reacquainted me with the symbolism of the Tarot in new ways!

$howing You the Money

As mentioned above, after IndieGoGo and Paypal each took out their portion in fees, the money from the 2015 IndieGoGo campaign paid for a lot of substantial costs, to include the remaining materials for creating 79 assemblages (78 tarot cards plus the Happy Squirrel), packing materials, hiring a professional editor for the Tarot of Bones book, and other associated costs. The remaining money has been set aside to help with future costs, to include printing and shipping. 

This is a flexible-funding campaign, which means that if I do not meet my goal, I still get the money (but IndieGoGo gets to keep a much larger percentage of it, 9% as opposed to 4%, not including Paypal's fees on top of that). Even if I don't raise $5,000, I will continue with the project with the goal of having the deck and book released Summer 2016; the successful completion of this campaign will make that much easier. 

While the majority of costs will go to the production of the set, I will be donating a to-be-decided portion of the proceeds to nonprofit organizations that benefit wildlife and their habitats. I am already a regular contributor to several of these organizations, including making monthly donations to a select few. While the exact amount I give varies from month to month depending on my income and expenses, I do what I can to help these organizations keep up their good work. 

Timeline, Risks & Challenges

You can see my up-to-date production schedule at www.thetarotofbones.com/production-schedule/ - so far I've managed to complete my tasks on schedule. The only major change since I started the Tarot of Bones project at the start of 2015 is that I have chosen to outsource the photography because, quite frankly, my photography skills aren't up to snuff. This has meant a small potential delay in production, but I am already negotiating with a photographer and once I have the photos on my hard drive I can get them ready for the printer. 
As I have maintained all along, it is not a matter of if the Tarot of Bones is happening, but when. The only big risk I see is a delayed release due to production and/or fundraising taking longer than anticipated. However, I am at least as eager as the rest of you to see this come to fruition, and with as much as I've already invested in it, I'm dedicated to seeing it through. 
You can keep up on updates here, on the Tarot of Bones website, or the official project Facebook Page.

Why Is This Project Important?

The Tarot of Bones is born out of a creative career spanning nearly two decades, embracing both writing and art, and challenging me to excellence not only in familiar media but in new skills as well. At the end of it, I will be able to offer others a valuable tool in divination as well as a beautiful work of art. 

Moreover, it's a reminder that we are still a part of the natural world. I chose bones as the primary material for this project because throughout the entirety of the body of a vertebrate animal–human included–the bones are the strongest portions. They provide a scaffolding on which the rest of the animal is built, and they remain long after flesh and sinew have gone away. Likewise, although generations of people come and go, the desire to connect to something greater than one’s self and to engage one’s intuition endures. Through bones we can speak with our evolutionary ancestors; through divination we create patterns that help us make sense of the world around us–and the worlds within.

Finally, whether you're able to back this campaign or not, please help spread the word! Use the share tools that IndieGoGo provides. Post a link on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and elsewhere. Email people you think would be interested. Contact alternative, art and other media sources who may be interested in covering what I'm working on here (I have a press release available if you need it!) The more people who know about this campaign, the merrier--and the stronger the Tarot of Bones will be!

Thank you to all of you for your help,

Lupa

http://www.thetarotofbones.com

I stayed within my production schedule with minimal alterations, and am still on course for a Summer 2016 release
Now I'm giving you a second opportunity to support the completion of the Tarot of Bones with the 2016 Campaign.Why a Second Campaign?Even though the first campaign ran for 45 days, I had a LOT of people tell me they missed out on the opportunity to back it, either because they didn't have the money at the time or didn't find out about it until later. This second campaign offers them a chance to pitch in and get the deck and book at a reduced rate (though not as low as in the first campaign). The initial Tarot of Bones IndieGoGo campaign raised a little over twice its $5,000 fundraising goal, an incredible outcome! After IndieGoGo and Paypal each took out their fees, I was able to:

Pay for the thousands of dollars of bones and other materials necessary to create the assemblages, which you can see on the Tarot of Bones website here


Order copies of my other books and other items that were selected as perks by campaign supporters


Print professional quality flyers and other promotional materials


Reserve funds to pay a professional editor for the Tarot of Bones companion book


Cover other administrative costs

I still have some of the funding left, and it will help defray remaining costs like shipping out the perks from the first campaign once the deck and book are out, but there are still significant outlays of money ahead including (but not limited to):
Printing an initial run of 2000 Tarot of Bones decks
Printing the 250+ preordered copies of the Tarot of Bones book through CreateSpace, plus those preordered during this IndieGoGo campaign
Shipping the decks and books from the printers to my home
And that's not including the fulfillment of perks for this campaign, official release parties to display the original assemblages before they're shipped to their new homes or put up for sale, and numerous other associated costs. 
$5,000 is not enough to cover all the above expenses, but it will make a healthy dent in them. The IndieGoGo campaigns are not the only source of funding for the project; I am putting a significant amount of my own money into the pot, no small feat given that I am 100% self-employed and the financial backbone of my household. I am not taking any of the IndieGoGo money for personal expenses like rent and bills, and putting hundreds of as-of-yet unpaid hours into the Tarot of Bones, so every dollar raised in this campaign helps ease the financial stress on my household.
What Do You Get For Your Contribution?This time around, you can select perk packages that don't necessarily include the deck and book--this is so folks who supported the first campaign (and thereby reserved the deck and book already) can pick out even more goodies if they like. If you want to get more than one perk package you'll need to make separate contributions, but nothing's stopping you from doing just that!So what sorts of goodies can you get by backing this campaign? Here are a few possibilities for you to choose from:

The Tarot of Bones Deck (with the companion paperback or ebook)

Prints of select cards, approximately 8" x 10" in size

A hand-sewn (by me!) leather bag to keep your deck in

Original assemblage pieces used in the making of the Tarot of Bones

Jewelry made from the jaws of skulls used in Tarot of Bones assemblages

T-shirts featuring art from the Tarot of Bones deck

Copies of my other books, your choice of which one(s)

A ten-card reading by me once I have my own copy of the Tarot of Bones

A special thank you in the Tarot of Bones companion book and on the official website
If you can't decide which one you reallllly want, keep in mind you can claim multiple perks by making multiple contributions.Also, please remember that perk amounts include my costs for materials for fulfilling and shipping them, and also account for IndieGoGo and Paypal taking out their fees!Now for a little more detail on some of these perks:The Tarot of Bones Deck and Book: This is the primary reason for all this effort! You can choose from the deck alone, or the book and deck together. They are offered at a discount (though not quite as big a discount as in the first campaign, especially considering IndieGoGo now allows shipping to be added in). A great deal, and a great way to help me raise the funds to get the printing done!Shirts: I'll be printing up t-shirts featuring the final photograph (without text) for the Magician card; the photo above just shows a prototype using my photo to test the print quality (looks even better in person!) The t-shirt perk is offered as a standalone, no cards or book included (you can always make another contribution if you want the deck and book!)Prints: I'll be making prints of three NEW pieces! In the last campaign I offered the Ace of Pentacles, the Magician and Judgment. This time around you have your choice of the Empress (shown between the first and second sections of this page), the Two of Pentacles (at the top of this paragraph) and the Hierophant (at the beginning of Timeline, Risks and Challenges).
Leather Pouch: Leather pouches were one of the first projects I learned to make when I initially started working with hides and bones. You can choose to claim a deck with a leather pouch made just the right size for it. US folks will get one made of deerskin; international folks will get cowhide due to customs restrictions. Pouches will be shipped when the decks are shipped in Summer 2016.Original Tarot of Bones Assemblage Piece: There are three different options for people in the U.S. who want to buy one of the original assemblage pieces used in making the Tarot of Bones. There is an additional option for international buyers to get one of a very limited number of the assemblage pieces that do not include wildlife or plant parts and can therefore be sent out of the U.S. While I will ultimately choose who gets which piece, you are welcome to contact me with your five favorites (you can see all the assemblages at www.thetarotofbones.com/the-cards). Also, as I will be displaying some of these originals at galleries and other art venues in the latter half of 2016, they will not be delivered to their new homes until sometime in 2017. (You will get your deck and book set plus any other perks in Summer 2016.)




Books: I've written and published several books prior to this project. You can choose to bring home one or more of these titles, shipped along with your Tarot of Bones set in Summer 2016:


Fang and Fur, Blood and Bone: A Primal Guide to Animal Magic
DIY Totemism: Your Personal Guide to Animal Totems
Skin Spirits: The Spiritual and Magical Uses of Animal Parts
New Paths to Animal Totems: Three Alternative Approaches to Creating Your Own Totemism
Plant and Fungus Totems: Connect With Spirits of Field, Forest and Garden
Nature Spirituality From the Ground Up: Connect With Totems in Your Bioregion
Please note that my anthologies are not included in this special offer. 


Limited Edition Jawbone Jewelry: I have a very small number of jawbones left over from skulls that were used in the creation of the Tarot of Bones assemblages. You can choose one of these exclusive pieces--made custom just for you--as a standalone perk (if you want the deck and book you'll need to make a separate contribution.)
Ten-card Reading: Once I have my own copy of the Tarot of Bones deck, I'll be giving people who choose this perk a ten card reading using the classic Celtic Cross spread. I have almost two decades of divination experience, and immersing myself in this project has reacquainted me with the symbolism of the Tarot in new ways!


$howing You the Money
As mentioned above, after IndieGoGo and Paypal each took out their portion in fees, the money from the 2015 IndieGoGo campaign paid for a lot of substantial costs, to include the remaining materials for creating 79 assemblages (78 tarot cards plus the Happy Squirrel), packing materials, hiring a professional editor for the Tarot of Bones book, and other associated costs. The remaining money has been set aside to help with future costs, to include printing and shipping. 
This is a flexible-funding campaign, which means that if I do not meet my goal, I still get the money (but IndieGoGo gets to keep a much larger percentage of it, 9% as opposed to 4%, not including Paypal's fees on top of that). Even if I don't raise $5,000, I will continue with the project with the goal of having the deck and book released Summer 2016; the successful completion of this campaign will make that much easier. 
While the majority of costs will go to the production of the set, I will be donating a to-be-decided portion of the proceeds to nonprofit organizations that benefit wildlife and their habitats. I am already a regular contributor to several of these organizations, including making monthly donations to a select few. While the exact amount I give varies from month to month depending on my income and expenses, I do what I can to help these organizations keep up their good work. 



Timeline, Risks & Challenges


You can see my up-to-date production schedule at www.thetarotofbones.com/production-schedule/ - so far I've managed to complete my tasks on schedule. The only major change since I started the Tarot of Bones project at the start of 2015 is that I have chosen to outsource the photography because, quite frankly, my photography skills aren't up to snuff. This has meant a small potential delay in production, but I am already negotiating with a photographer and once I have the photos on my hard drive I can get them ready for the printer. 
As I have maintained all along, it is not a matter of if the Tarot of Bones is happening, but when. The only big risk I see is a delayed release due to production and/or fundraising taking longer than anticipated. However, I am at least as eager as the rest of you to see this come to fruition, and with as much as I've already invested in it, I'm dedicated to seeing it through. 
You can keep up on updates here, on the Tarot of Bones website, or the official project Facebook Page.



Why Is This Project Important?

The Tarot of Bones is born out of a creative career spanning nearly two decades, embracing both writing and art, and challenging me to excellence not only in familiar media but in new skills as well. At the end of it, I will be able to offer others a valuable tool in divination as well as a beautiful work of art. Moreover, it's a reminder that we are still a part of the natural world. I chose bones as the primary material for this project because throughout the entirety of the body of a vertebrate animal–human included–the bones are the strongest portions. They provide a scaffolding on which the rest of the animal is built, and they remain long after flesh and sinew have gone away. Likewise, although generations of people come and go, the desire to connect to something greater than one’s self and to engage one’s intuition endures. Through bones we can speak with our evolutionary ancestors; through divination we create patterns that help us make sense of the world around us–and the worlds within.
Finally, whether you're able to back this campaign or not, please help spread the word! Use the share tools that IndieGoGo provides. Post a link on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and elsewhere. Email people you think would be interested. Contact alternative, art and other media sources who may be interested in covering what I'm working on here (I have a press release available if you need it!) The more people who know about this campaign, the merrier--and the stronger the Tarot of Bones will be!
Thank you to all of you for your help,
Lupa
http://www.thetarotofbones.com

story:
No Apologies Art Collective

is a project born of a love for all art. However, art can be inaccessible to some and there are many hurdles for those who create it. With art programs getting cut from schools and prices of museums, live music and performing arts rising we wanted to create a company that prints limited editions of shirts with designs from independent artists.

We want art to be accessible. We want to give artists an outlet for their work to be displayed so they can be honest in their art and be paid a fair wage. We also wanted to produce a product that gives back.The shirts will be made in the US and created with eco-friendly screen printing methods. Also a portion of sales will be donated annually to four different charitable organizations that will support Art Education, Mental Health treatment advocacy, survivors of Domestic Abuse, and the Environment. 

This project will allow artists to share their work. It will allow art collectors to expand their collections.  Even if we do not reach our goal we will still continue to produce and sell limited editions of t-shirts as long as we have an audience interested in wearing them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with donations we need ARTISTS. No Apologies Art Collective can't exist without original art so please submit your work or tell the artists in your life to contact us. For more information about becoming one of our artists please visit our website at www.noapologiesac.com

If you have other ideas on how to contribute to the growth of No Apologies Art Collective or have any questions, feel free to contact us at noapologiesac@gmail.com

story:
For the past 18 months, volunteers have worked to transform a former lumber store into the Red Curtain Arts Center in Marysville, bringing arts education and programming to the underserved population of north Snohomish County. 

The lease on the building expires on Feb. 1, and we are raising funds for closing costs and a down payment to maintain occupancy of the space, continue Red Curtain's ongoing community impact, and expand our efforts to create a true center for the arts.  

The Red Curtain Foundation for the Arts was founded by a group of local arts supporters and educators in 2009 as a non-profit arts education and production organization. We came together with the goal of bringing artistic experiences to underserved communities, especially nearby areas hit hardest by the recession. We were passionate about keeping the arts affordable, and ensuring that people from all walks of life would have the opportunity to participate as artists, students and audience members.

In 2013, our operations moved into a one-time lumber store in Marysville, Washington. This location was chosen because its size will allow the organization to grow, the layout works well for an arts center and performance space, and it is located in the heart of this growing town. But, mostly, we moved into the space because Marysville, with a population of nearly 65,000 residents, had no existing arts center or even an adequate community meeting space.

Over the past 18 months, our all-volunteer staff has worked tirelessly raising funds to bring the structure up to current building codes. These efforts paid off, and the Red Curtain Arts Center officially opened its doors in April of 2014. We immediately began offering classes, producing plays, and making the space available for renters and other community groups.

Marysville's mayor, city council members and RCF volunteers celebrated the official ribbon-cutting in April 2014.

But last month we were informed by the property owners that our lease agreement will expire at the end of January of 2015, and it will not be renewed. We have an immediate need to raise the funds necessary to close on the purchase of the property, or this small community will lose its only arts facility. 

While we recognize that a goal of $50,000 is a challenge, we are focused on garnering support from 1,000 people who can contribute just $50 each.

The property, 1.5 acres of prime commercial real estate, has been appraised at $2.6 million, but Red Curtain has negotiated a purchase price of just $1 million, to be paid over 10 years. The total amount needed for the down payment and closing costs is approximately $120,000. Through partnerships and connections we've developed within Marysville, with the Tulalip Tribes and individual donors, we have potential commitments for as much as $70,000 towards our goal. Now we find ourselves reaching out to the community, and taking a grassroots approach to fund the balance.

An Achievable Goal

Last year at this time we ran our first crowd funding campaign on Indiegogo to fund the installation of a fire monitoring system, and to make necessary safety and ADA-required upgrades to the arts center. That work was completed last April, thanks to broad community support and the donations raised from that initial campaign. Since then, our classes, programming and ongoing donations have helped us cover the operating expenses of about $3,500 per month, but have not allowed us to make significant progress towards purchasing the property.

Your contribution to this new campaign will allow us to keep operating in Marysville, a community that has enthusiastically welcomed us. More than this, having the property listed in Red Curtain's name will allow the organization to pursue other options which were not available to us as a renter, including the ability to receive a property tax waiver (saving approximately $24,000 per year).

Finding one thousand people who share our passion for invigorating the community through the arts seems like an attainable goal. However, if we aren't able to fulfill our financial obligations, funds raised through this campaign will instead be used to cover transportation fees and storage costs for all of Red Curtain's lighting and sound equipment, set pieces and costumes...but we don't want to think about that outcome.

The Impact: A Stronger Community

When creative activity is happening in large and small ways throughout an area, it creates surprising ripple effects of benefits, even for those who don't participate directly. The arts ripple effect creates at least two kinds of benefits: 1) in the economic vitality of an area; and 2) in how communities come together and understand each other.

--The Arts Ripple Effect, by TOPOS Partnership for the Fine Arts Fund, 2008

Red Curtain has had the opportunity to establish partnerships with a number of local arts and community organizations, many of which are excited to have access to a facility devoted to the local arts community. The Marysville City Bands, Northern Sound Choirs, Marysville Arts Coalition, the Public Servants and Final Boss Productions have all been invited to consider the arts center their “home,” with rehearsals and member meetings – as well as performances – being held on the premises.

Red Curtain's ongoing educational programming features a variety of classes for all ages and experience levels. Offerings include theatre classes for kids aged 6-16; monthly open mic and acoustic jam for musicians of all ages; piano, guitar and acting lessons for all ages; and classes in a variety of theatrical skills for those 16 and up.

As public schools struggle with declining budgets, arts programs are often targeted for cutbacks. Both in K-12 and in secondary education, students are offered fewer opportunities to learn about and participate in the arts—both visual and performing arts—even though creative activities have been shown to increase critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

A comprehensive study by the President’s Committee on the Arts and Humanities (PCAH) “clearly shows the effect of arts education on student academic achievement,” noting that communities with robust arts programs aid in “improving test scores and fostering their students’ competitiveness in the workforce.”

Participation in supervised, creative group activities in a safe and supportive space is especially valuable for teens who may otherwise choose to spend their time in less constructive ways. The link between creative self-expression and appropriate societal behavior, as well as enhanced academic performance, has been documented time and time again.

Developing a performing arts center for the north Snohomish County communities of Marysville, Tulalip, Arlington—as well as Lake Stevens, Stanwood, Granite Falls and other outlying areas—will contribute to the overall quality of life in the area. The performance space will complement other tourist attractions and entertainment venues in the region, giving visitors another reason to spend time and money in the area and contributing to the local economy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is in a financial position to donate money, but there are other, equally important ways to help. The most important non-cash contribution to the success of this campaign is to share it with your friends and family. The more people who hear about this project, accompanied by a passionate request for donations from you, the more likely we will meet this goal. Tell your friends why this project is important to you, and you'll be surprised by the positive effects.

Sharing the campaign on social networks like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram will also help to gain followers and supporters to the project.

You can also help by leaving a comment on this page, which helps boost our campaign ranking on Indiegogo's pages, increasing our exposure to an international audience of donors.

If you or someone you know wants to help but are not comfortable providing your personal info online, donations can be mailed to Red Curtain at PO Box 1713, Marysville, WA 98270, or you can come by the arts center from 2-6pm, Monday through Saturday, and speak to one of our volunteers in person.

story:
Dreams And Nightmares - Oracle Of The Night

Viele von euch kennen und lieben mein selbst entworfenes Online-Orakel:

Oracle of the night. ← Link

Im vergangenen Jahr habe ich erfolglos versucht eine Druckerei, zu finden, die mein Orakelset für den Hausgebrauch herstellt. Erfolglos deshalb, da es zum einen Probleme mit dem Druckformat gab und ich zum anderen an den Produktionskosten gescheitert bin.

In den vergangenen Wochen, kamen wieder vermehrt Anfragen für ein „greifbares“ Kartendeck. Also habe ich mich noch mal auf die Suche nach einer Druckerei gemacht und bin fündig geworden. Sowohl das benötigte Format ist verfügbar, als auch der Preis akzeptabel. Allerdings bei der Abnahme einer großen Menge. Das ist der Grund, warum ich euch hier um Unterstützung bitte. Ich möchte gerne 100 Decks drucken lassen, damit ich mein Orakelset unter die Leute bringen kann . Weiterhin habe ich so die Möglichkeit Beispielkarten mit Konzeptbeschreibung an verschiedene Verlage zu senden, um eine größere Chance zu einem Vertrieb über den Handel zu erhalten. Denn die meisten einschlägigen Verlage geben sich mit digitalen Bildern nicht zufrieden. Sollte ein Verlag über meine Bitte hier stolpern und möchte mein Deck verlegen...bin ich hocherfreut.

Leider übersteigen die Druckkosten mein Budget und ich bitte euch mich kräftig zu unterstützen. Die Kosten setzen sich wie folgt zusammen:

100 Decks zu 108 Karten im Format 10x10 - Baumwollsäckchen als ökologische Verpackung - sonstige anfallende Kosten, wie Porto - 1920,00 € Gebühren Indiegogo - 80,00 € Gesamtsumme: 2000,00 €

Sollte das Goal überschritten werden, wird das zusätzliche Geld für den Druck von weiteren Decks verwendet.

Als Kartendeck besteht das Orakel aus 54 originellen Bildkarten und 54 Karten mit innovativen Sprüchen. Das Konzept ist ziemlich einzigartig für Orakelkarten, da eben nicht ein Text einem Bild zugeordnet ist, so, wie wir es zumeist kennen. Dadurch ergeben sich - genauso wie beim Onlineorakel - X Antwortmöglichkeiten.

verlegen...bin ich hocherfreut.Leider übersteigen die Druckkosten mein Budget und ich bitte euch mich kräftig zu unterstützen.
Die Kosten setzen sich wie folgt zusammen:100 Decks zu 108 Karten im Format 10x10  	- 	
Baumwollsäckchen als ökologische Verpackung 	-	
sonstige anfallende Kosten, wie Porto 		-	1920,00 €
Gebühren Indiegogo 				-	  	80,00 €
Gesamtsumme:						2000,00 €Sollte das Goal überschritten werden, wird das zusätzliche Geld für den Druck von weiteren Decks verwendet.Als
 Kartendeck besteht das Orakel aus 54 originellen Bildkarten und 54 
Karten mit innovativen Sprüchen.
Das Konzept ist ziemlich einzigartig für Orakelkarten, da eben nicht ein
 Text einem Bild zugeordnet ist, so, wie wir es zumeist kennen.
Dadurch ergeben sich - genauso wie beim Onlineorakel - X Antwortmöglichkeiten.

story:
Summary

Now more than ever the performing arts needs support from people like you! A donation to the Interference Series ensures that the underground and alternative performance scene in Northern Arizona will continue to grow and thrive. 

The Interference Series has built a community of performers and audience members from diverse backgrounds in Flagstaff, Arizona that supports and actively engages with experimental performance. In it's second season, the quantity and caliber of artists being featured on the series has outgrown its current infrastructure. In essence, we need YOUR support to fund venue rentals, artist fees, and advertising! 

What We Need & What You Get

Monthly expenses breakdown:

Advertising (printed materials): $100

Venue Fees: $100

Videographer/Archival project: $50

Actually paying participating artists modest flat rate fee: $200

Annual expenses projection: The season goes from October 2016 – June 2017. Three performances a month

Advertising (printed materials): $900

Venue Fees: $900

Videographer/Archival project: $450

Actually paying participating artists modest flat rate fee: $1800

Total expenses for one season: $4050

The most important reward from this for you (aside from the perks) is the knowledge that you supported locally-made and curated art as well as a space in which international artists to engage with a community yearning for new experiences. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to provide monetary support in this time, no problem! Please take a moment to share this fundraiser with your friends and family through email or social media.

story:
Who We Are

We are an artist team ~ Kasia Polkowska and Kyle Cunniff.  We met 14 years ago while studying art at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, New York.  Currently we live in Alamosa, Colorado. We work in various media from glass, to painting, to sculpture and more!  We love to make beautiful, colorful art to share with the people around us. 

Help Support Our First Community Mural Project!

Alamosa, like most rural towns, has seen lack luster growth over the years due to the big box stores taking business from its historic downtown, despite being only 30 minutes from the Sand Dunes National Park. This year Artscape, a sculpture program was launched to drive more tourism into downtown. We hope to keep this excitement and momentum going by adding our mural project to Main Street.  Below you can see one of our community groups working to help us make this mural a reality!

  • Kasia created the Lotus Flower Design for the project.
  • Kyle created engineering drawings to submit to the Colorado Historical Foundation and was granted approval to display artwork on The Center for Restorative Programs building.
  • Through Colorado Creative Industries, Jeff Owlsey, Small Business Director here in Alamosa, has already been able to secure a $500 grant in funding to cover a portion of the project.  He has also been helping us recruit volunteers via his Social Ops Group.
  • Luke Yoder, director at The Center for Restorative Programs has organized groups of volunteers to work on the project.
  • Kasia and Kyle are hosting volunteers in their studio, teaching them a new craft while everyone makes a section to contribute to the final mural.
  • Kasia and Kyle are providing refreshments for the volunteers including homebred goods by Kyle =)
  • Kasia and Kyle will also work to create various sections of the mural and will glue, grout and install the completed project.

The Impact

We want to bring more beauty and color into Alamosa.  When community members see beauty all around them its inspiring and it makes a difference in their quality of life. It can also help to bring folks from all over to come experience our historic town and to help with the growth of our Main Street.

  • We want to bring more public art and community art projects to smaller, rural communities in Colorado.
  • This is a great opportunity for us to share our unique talents and skills with our community members for whom this is a rare chance to take part in a free, educational and rewarding artistic event. 

What We Need

We need your help to fund the additional costs of materials for this truly unique public art project.  Below is the break down of the expenses we've incurred thus far, not including travel time/cost to acquire materials (we drove 4 hours to Denver to get many of our supplies), the refreshments for our volunteers, the actual time we've dedicated to this project, the costs associated with using our studio and the cost of the fees for running the campaign.  The $1,500 that we've outlined below is just the materials cost for creating the mural.  

  • $465 -   a custom, removable steel frame (in order to be in line with the guidelines set up by the historical society)
  • $250 -   2 sheets of 4ft x 8 ft Wedi boards (Kyle will create a weather proof substrate with these)
  • $50   -    exterior red wood 2"x4"x8' boards (to be used for the substrate construction)
  • $10    -   construction adhesive for wood backing
  • $65   -    tamper proof bolts (for installing the framed mosaic onto the building)
  • $50   -    pattern printouts (for templates for volunteers to use as well as for constructing the mural)
  • $250 -   36 square feet of colored stained glass
  • $135  -   Latapoxy 300 an exterior epoxy adhesive
  • $92    -   Spectralock Pro Premium an exterior epoxy grout
  • $25    -   miscellaneous items such as tape, markers, gloves, rags, screws
  • $50    -   mural project plaque
  • $100  -   a second plaque for honor the potential high donors from this campaign to be placed next to the mural

Total Cost of Mural Materials:  $1,442

Total Cost of Mural Materials if we get the second plaque:  $1,542

The Perks

We tried to keep it pretty simple but we still feel that we've got some great options for our supporters.  Note: If you do not want a perk, there is a special option to donate without claiming a reward.  All donors will be listed on the Kasia Mosaics Website on the project page, unless they'd like to keep their name private.

Our simplest perk is Gratitude ~ we hope that many folks will donate $5 just because they believe in the power of art!  

We'll professionally photograph the completed mural and use the imagery to create thank you cards as well as signed poster prints.  We always strive for the highest quality products so these will be a great choice for those who can donate just a little bit more.

We know that there are many mosaic enthusiasts out there, trying to learn this unique art form so we have a special perk just for them.  Through our campaign, you can save $5 on the popular flower templates from the Kasia Mosaics Online Flower Class.  Below are examples of the flowers you can make using the 12 designs - the possibilities are endless!  Not for commercial use.

If you love mosaics but need a little help getting started on a project, the Kasia Mosaics Online Flower Class is the perfect option for you.  Only 3 spots are available at a once-in-a-lifetime price of $100! Click the link to read more about what the class entails  http://www.kasiamosaicsclasses.com/course/online-flower-class/

We are also giving away Good Karma for all other $100 donations as well as honoring all $250 donors with names on an honorary plaque that we'll add next to the mural.

If you love our mission, love mosaic flowers and would like to donate $250, you can choose between one of the hand made 12"x12" framed stained glass mosaics pictured below created by Kasia.

The 'Blue Daisy' is framed in ebony black. 


The 'Tangerine Zinnia' is framed in golden oak.

Risks & Challenges

The project is currently in process. It is largely funded by the artists Kasia and Kyle because they really believe in its value but the hope is to raise enough funds to cover the cost of materials.  If the goal is not met, the project will still proceed as planned but the artists will not be reimbursed for their expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this campaign on social media with friends, family and co-workers. Every donation helps!

Thank You!!!

story:
Qu'est-ce que Unheimlich?

Par la poésie, bousculer, questionner et vivre. Voilà la mission du collectif de poésie de la relève Exond&. Cette année, le collectif s’attaque à l’angoisse existentielle et la peur avec sa performance poétique Unheimlich. Le monde contemporain carbure aux apparences de bonheur. Mais quels démons se cachent sous ce besoin suraffirmé de plaisir? Quelles sont ces noirceurs (anodines ou viscérales) qui affligent nos actions, notre vie, voire notre siècle? Qu’y a-t-il à fuir et à embrasser dans ces moments où l’univers nous écrase?

Unheimlich, c'est l'écriture poétique de six artistes qui livrent leurs perceptions de l’angoisse, dans une mise en scène qui mêle la performance, la poésie, le mouvement et le théâtre.

Unheimlich sera présenté le 10 mars 2016 au Studio P.

D'où vient l'idée?

Les six membres d'Exond& ont toujours eu la passion de la poésie et de la performance. Pour Unheimlich, l'idée d'explorer le thème de l’angoisse s'est imposée en regardant notre société et ses enjeux. L’angoisse est sur le point de devenir le nouveau mal du siècle, et pourtant on n’en parle qu’à mots couverts. Nos poitrines serrées, en baromètres de notre environnement social, cherchent, malgré nous, à nous faire comprendre quelque chose qui nous est inconnu et difficile à appréhender. Serait-ce que le poids des apparences devient trop lourd à porter? Que nous nous éloignons trop des réalités du monde?  Résonnons-nous avec quelque chose de plus profond que nous redoutons de comprendre? Par la poésie, Exond& explorera les peurs que chacun porte pour pousser la réflexion sur ce que ces cordes sensibles nous chantent.

Qu'est-ce qui prouve qu'on peut y arriver?

Le projet Unheimlich est le troisième projet d'Exond&. L'an dernier, le collectif a présenté, à guichet fermé, NORMPORN, spectacle poétique sur les marginalités sexuelles. En 2014, Exond& a monté un spectacle dans le noir au Morrin Center, Le Déjectoire, où colère et perversion s'imbriquaient pour interroger ce que chacun cache dans l'ombre. La présence du collectif sur Indiegogo vise surtout à combler les besoins financiers du projet.

Le collectif Exond& compte 6 membres actifs :

  • Véronique Langlais
  • Éric LeBlanc
  • Ariane Lessard
  • Émilie St-Pierre
  • Émilie Turmel
  • Anaël Turcotte

Pourquoi nous encourager?

En interrogeant l’intériorité secrète de chacun, en s'attaquant au sujet délicat de l’angoisse et de la peur, et en repoussant les frontières du récital poétique et de la performance, Unheimlich s'impose comme une initiative artistique unique et audacieuse. La réalisation de ce nouveau projet d'Exond& contribuera à montrer l'originalité et la témérité artistique de la relève littéraire de Québec.

Ce qu'on va faire avec les sous?

Les sous demandés pour Unheimlich permettront de garantir une performance plus poignante et impressionnante. Ceux-ci iront directement dans le paiement des cachets du metteur en scène et du concepteur sonore, ainsi que dans la location et l'achat d'équipements pour la performance : costumes, éclairages spéciaux.

Qui sont les gens déjà impliqués dans le projet?

Unheimlich, ce sera non seulement une expérience littéraire et poétique, mais également une performance en lumière et en mouvement. Pour nous venir en aide, le concepteur sonore Frédéric Dufour et le metteur en scène Guillaume Pepin se sont joints aux membres du collectif. Avec leur expérience, ils permettront aux ambitions artistiques de Unheimlich de se réaliser.

Que faire avec les sous si on dépasse le montant?

Tout surplus amassé grâce à votre générosité permettra à Unheimlich de payer plus décemment son concepteur sonore, son metteur en scène, son photographe et sa vidéaste (qui aident notre projet par amour de l'art plus que par bénéfice personnel), ira dans l'achat de plus d'équipement pour le spectacle et alimentera un fond pour produire les productions futures du collectif.

Pourquoi ce projet nous tient à coeur?

Unheimlich, c’est toucher à des tabous insoupçonnés : l’angoisse, la peur dans le contexte contemporain, le jardin plus que secret, le stress et ses impacts, ainsi que la maladie mentale. Le collectif veut, tout comme dans ses projets précédents, déranger ce qui est normal, se débarrasser des apparences ne serait-ce que le temps d’un spectacle et montrer à tous ce dont ils ont l’air une fois mis à nus : vulnérables, humains, petits, et pourtant plus près de l’universel que jamais. En fait, c'est vouloir utiliser l'art pour parler de ce qui se dit moins, mais qui doit se dire.

(Crédit photo : Pascal Audet)

story:
Summary

I am Kirsty Harris - an artist raised in Yorkshire and based in London, UK.

To accompany my upcoming solo exhibition at Vane Gallery planned for later in the year,
I announce the forthcoming release - A 12” Vinyl picture disc of my audio piece:

How I Learned to Stop Worrying (1945-2019)

Listen to an excerpt above

This composition is a musical account of every officially recorded nuclear explosion detonated between 1945 and the present day:

  • Each different instrument represents a country that partook
  • Each month in history lasts a second on the record
  • Each note played depicts a single bomb

The 8 musicians who contributed to this work are: Terry Edwards, Marion Andrau, Dan Cundy, Tom Savage, Graham Brittain, Anne-Marie Watson, Lucy Woodhouse and Sarita Jepps. They range from world renowned musicians to my housemates at the time (no offence Reets)

  • I originally made this audio art work in 2013 and I update it, alongside history, everytime it is shown in an exhibition.
  • This record will make you realise the magnitude of the nuclear testing program, around our planet, with over 2000 explosions - the audio lasts over 14 minutes.
  • I'm really grateful for your support in making this happen!

What I Need & What You'll Get

  • This is your chance to own a piece of history, the sooner you back the project, the cheaper the record is!
  • The 12" vinyl will have an images of my oil paintings on both sides. As it hasn't been produced yet, I've photoshopped the images to show you in advance, but these are the paintings I will use.
  • It will arrive in a sturdy clear sleeve with a specially designed sticker.
  • £1750 will cover the cost of an initial pressing of 300 x 12" picture discs + full colour postcards - landed and ready to post out to you.
  • The record is released on the ComeQuickDisaster Label.

The Impact

  • Supporting this campaign will enable me to produce this extraordinary piece of art without incurring debt (I have successfully managed ACE grants and awards in the past, spreadsheets are my friend)
  • I want the chance to share my art work with as many people as possible, including you!
  • If my goal is surpassed the additional funds will be spent on art materials and equipment (required to produce new art work for my solo exhibition at Vane Gallery)
  • 50 of the 300 records will be held back and sent out to prominent museums and galleries, around the UK and worldwide, to introduce them to my artistic practice and invite them to my exhibition.
  • The 8 musicians who helped me make this art work will receive one record each.

Risks

  • Production will go ahead, no matter how much is raised - your orders will be fulfilled.
  • I risk maxing out my credit card and ending up with a bedroom full of records.

Ways You Can Help Me Out

  • If you can't afford to support this campaign with hard cash, please give me a big shout out and make some noise about my record!
  • If you choose to back the campaign, people you know might like the it too! Sharing it really does make a difference. Use the Indiegogo tools, or to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram Stories & Pinterest.
  • Please help me spread the word, I'm calling in favours! We are more than the sum of our parts!

You can see more of my work here - www.kirstyharris.com
story_txt:
Summary
I am Kirsty Harris - an artist raised in Yorkshire and based in London, UK.
To accompany my upcoming solo exhibition at Vane Gallery planned for later in the year,I announce the forthcoming release - A 12” Vinyl picture disc of my audio piece:
How I Learned to Stop Worrying (1945-2019)

Listen to an excerpt above
This composition is a musical account of every officially recorded nuclear explosion detonated between 1945 and the present day:

Each different instrument represents a country that partook
Each month in history lasts a second on the record
Each note played depicts a single bomb

The 8 musicians who contributed to this work are: Terry Edwards, Marion Andrau, Dan Cundy, Tom Savage, Graham Brittain, Anne-Marie Watson, Lucy Woodhouse and Sarita Jepps. They range from world renowned musicians to my housemates at the time (no offence Reets)

I originally made this audio art work in 2013 and I update it, alongside history, everytime it is shown in an exhibition.
This record will make you realise the magnitude of the nuclear testing program, around our planet, with over 2000 explosions - the audio lasts over 14 minutes.
I'm really grateful for your support in making this happen!


What I Need & What You'll Get

This is your chance to own a piece of history, the sooner you back the project, the cheaper the record is!
The 12" vinyl will have an images of my oil paintings on both sides. As it hasn't been produced yet, I've photoshopped the images to show you in advance, but these are the paintings I will use.
It will arrive in a sturdy clear sleeve with a specially designed sticker.
£1750 will cover the cost of an initial pressing of 300 x 12" picture discs + full colour postcards - landed and ready to post out to you.
The record is released on the ComeQuickDisaster Label.


The Impact

Supporting this campaign will enable me to produce this extraordinary piece of art without incurring debt (I have successfully managed ACE grants and awards in the past, spreadsheets are my friend)
I want the chance to share my art work with as many people as possible, including you!
If my goal is surpassed the additional funds will be spent on art materials and equipment (required to produce new art work for my solo exhibition at Vane Gallery)
50 of the 300 records will be held back and sent out to prominent museums and galleries, around the UK and worldwide, to introduce them to my artistic practice and invite them to my exhibition.
The 8 musicians who helped me make this art work will receive one record each.


Risks

Production will go ahead, no matter how much is raised - your orders will be fulfilled.
I risk maxing out my credit card and ending up with a bedroom full of records.


Ways You Can Help Me Out

If you can't afford to support this campaign with hard cash, please give me a big shout out and make some noise about my record!
If you choose to back the campaign, people you know might like the it too! Sharing it really does make a difference. Use the Indiegogo tools, or to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram Stories & Pinterest.
Please help me spread the word, I'm calling in favours! We are more than the sum of our parts!

You can see more of my work here - www.kirstyharris.com

story:
TITRE DE RÊVE

Nous sommes 20 étudiant-e-s en art de l’Université Laval, qui terminons notre baccalauréat cette année. Nous nous regroupons pour organiser une exposition d’envergure pour clore notre passage à La Fabrique, l’École d’art à Québec. 

Pour nous toutes et tous, cette exposition est l’aboutissement de trois années de travail chevronné et elle représente une occasion rêvée de présenter le fruit de nos recherches en peinture, dessin, sculpture, installation, vidéo, performance, estampe, etc.

En mai, nous occuperons les locaux nouvellement aménagés du 3eme étage de La Fabrique dans le but d’ouvrir notre milieu de vie au grand public. 

Nous cherchons à amasser 1 500$ pour financer une foule de dépenses liées à cette exposition: nous aurons besoin de ressources pour veiller à l'organisation et au bon déroulement du vernissage, sans compter l’achat du matériel associé au montage et au démontage de l'exposition.

Nous avons récolté des fonds tout au long de la dernière année (foires, soirées, marchés, friperies) et nous tendons la main une dernière fois dans l’espoir d’amasser les 1 500$ manquants à la bonne tenue de notre exposition.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Lynde Mendoza.  I am trying to raise money to help pay for the funeral of my Brother (Charles Burleson), and the funeral of my Sister-in-law (Tammy Burleson).  They both died within 3 days of each other.  My Sister-in-law died on June 26th of a horrible asthma attack.  Then on June 29th my Brother was found dead in his bed.  They had one daughter, Tiffany..25 years old.  They also had one Grandson.. 3 years old.  Tiffany has lost both her parents, and also hit with 20K in funeral bills, as neither of them had life insurance.  Charles, and Tammy had given up their home, to live with our Mother after the loss of our Dad in December 2011.  Our Dad was killed by a drunk driver on December 6 last year.  We have been hit HARD, as we have lost half of our family in a period of 6 months.

What We Need

We need $20,000 to pay off both funerals... Any funds that we recieve are going directly to the funeral home, towards the funerals of both.  If you can help us, it will truely be a blessing, and appreciated more than I can describe!  Norton Funeral home in Hartsville, SC is whom we owe the money to, and you can see the obituary's online.

The Impact

The impact at this point would be to lift 20K in debt from my 25 year old neice, as she is at a young age, with a young child, and in a really bad position in her life right now.. Tiffany has lost BOTH her parents, at the age of 25, and is responsible for the cost of BOTH funerals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

Please share my campaign to get the word out. Also, Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story

For the longest time, Las Vegas had a severely underrepresented poetry and art scene throughout the city, but recently this has changed. First Friday in Las Vegas absolutely floods the 18b Art District, outstanding promoters are putting on great concerts and plays, and weekly open mics and monthly poetry slams have been inundated with new talent, eager to show off their skills to a local crowd.

Now, these remarkable performers are set to take their show to Cambridge, MA and represent Las Vegas at the National Poetry Slam. The National Poetry Slam is a competition of 80+ teams of poets from around the country, vying for huge prizes, national recognition, and most importantly building a community of thoughtful and articulate artists bent on making a difference in society. The Las Vegas Poetry Slam team wants desperately to be a part of this, to put Las Vegas back on the map, and to help increase visibility to bring more performers to feature in Las Vegas in the future, BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!


The Impact

If our campaign succeeds, it will not only send our 5-man team to the National Poetry Slam, but will provide that team with a chance to bring it all back home by networking with incredible performers who can be brought in to help grow the scene right in Las Vegas. Success means turning Las Vegas Poetry from a small scene of dedicated writers, performers, and organizers into a national-level scene with regular featured poets, high-quality workshops, and more festival-style shows integrating outstanding spoken word performers with remarkable musicians.

If our campaign doesn't succeed, it won't be the end of the world, but it may be the end of a very incredible chance to provide high-quality, potentially life-changing art to our community in the future. Of course, shows will go on, but without your help to reach our funding goals, the scene may wither up into a sad husk of its current beauty - and no one wants that. SO PLEASE HELP!


What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise over $5000 altogether, and your contribution here on IndieGoGo matters! All of this funding goes toward team and venue registration with Poetry Slam, Inc. (~$800), team travel expenses for the National Poetry Slam event (~$4,000), and travel expenses for the regional competitions required to qualify us for National Poetry Slam (~$1,000). FEAR NOT! If we don't reach our full goal here on IndieGoGo, our fundraising continues all around Las Vegas and on-line, and all donations from IndieGoGo will still be directly applied to these expenses. Your money will not go to waste! Even if the team is unable to make our goal and send the whole group to Nationals, partial funding will help to send a group of non-competing representatives and any excess will all go into an on-going Las Vegas Poetry Slam fund, still to be used to effectively bring high quality artists to Las Vegas for performances, workshops, and seminars.

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from just helping fund our journey, you can lend a major hand by sharing this cause with your friends on Facebook and other social media, contributing promotional materials or discounted costs for such materials (flyers, airline buddy passes, hotel rewards) to reduce our overall expected costs, or simply spreading the word that art is alive in Las Vegas, and that people can help it achieve greater recognition in the midst of this jungle of one-armed bandits!

story:
About me:

I am a musician and an artist primarily working in the silk-screened gig poster world - designing and printing posters for bands all over the world. I have been practicing as an accredited professional for 5 years now and I want to open my own studio here in Chicago. My work has been featured in galleries in the US and abroad and I have been featured in BUST magazine, the internationally published book, Gigposters Volume 2, and a recent documentary about poster art by Scout Shannon called "Just Like Being There" I moved to Chicago to pursue my dream of doing what I am doing now so help me take it to the next level!
 

Funding:

I hope to raise at least $1000 to help me with various pieces of equipment and to make my shop function in the most professional and economical way. Money will go towards building an exposure unit and drying racks, basic supplies like emulsion, ink, and various chemicals, and towards paying for the space where the shop will be located.
 
Everyone who contributes $25 will get a print made specifially for this campaign
Those who contribute $100 will get 2 posters and 2 art prints
If you contribute more than $300 will get 10 pieces of my work
 
Why Help?
Like most artists, I do not have a lot of money. I have worked many a service job throughout my life just to make ends meet. I have always believed that I was capable of making art for a living and I am almost to the point where I live solely on that dream. Please help me solidify what I have been working towards for the bulk of my life

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link with your friends and family and in your social media spheres
My work can be seen at
www.killhatsumomoprints.com
www.facebook.com/killhatsumomo
 
Thank you for your support!

SU CONTRIBUCION ECONOMICA SOLIDARIA HARA POSIBLE LA CREACION DE ESTA OBRA INDEPENDIENTE
 
DESCRIPCION
Caramba es un espectÃ¡culo cÃ³mico de danza y teatro clown que cuenta la historia bailada de AmÃ©rica Latina.
Dos enamordidos: Carmentea y Bonifacio, bailan desde su patria perdida hasta poco importa donde, para encantarnos con sus cuerpos, la tragedia permanente y la comedia infinita del latino. Una aventura histÃ©rica a ritmo de salsa, samba, tango y mÃºsica andina.


CÃ³MO APOYARNOS

profesional. Su apoyo es fundamental para nosotros. El dinero serÃ¡ destinado a la adqusiciÃ³n de la escenografÃ­a y al pago de viÃ¡ticos y honorarios de nuestros colaboradores y tambiÃ©n de Carmentea y BonifacioÂ¡

En este momento contamos con la asesorÃ­a artÃ­stica de LE TRUNK COLLECTIVE y con el apoyo del programa JEUNES VOLONTAIRES de Emploi Quebec. Durante el mes de Febrero contaremos con 50 horas de estudio en el MAI, Montreal artes interculturales, para continuar explorando la creaciÃ³n. 


OBJETIVO
Crear una pieza de danza cÃ³smica, (digo, cÃ³mica), o quizÃ¡s una comedia dÃ¡nsica, (como mejor les sueÃ±e la cosa) que nos permita enamorar y sensibilizar el mundo cruel y despistado acerca de la realidad y la historia
Latinoamericana.

Esta espectacular puesta en escena se presentarÃ¡ en los festivales de verano del 2012 en la ciudad de Montreal, en la provincia de Quebec y por quÃ© no, alrededor del mundo al verrez.
Con su ayuda u apoyo, produciremos una obra de renombramiento inter-planetaria, algo nunca jamÃ¡s visto u imaginado, un destello de risa, sabor y belleza.

POR FAVOR PASEN ESTA INFORMACION A SUS CONTACTOS!

MUCHAS GRACIAS!

---

VOTRE CONTRIBUTION AIDE DE FACON SOLIDAIRE A LA CREATION DE CE PROJET ARTISTIQUE INDEPENDENT

DESCRIPTION
Caramba est un piece duo de danse, theatre et clown qui racont l'histoire d'AmÃ©rique Latine en dansant.
Deux amoureux, Bonifacio et Carmentea, voyagent de leur patrie perdu jusqu'a n'importe ou, pour nous raconter avec leur corps la tragedie permanente et la comÃ©die infinie du LATINO . Une aventure histerique aux rythmes du tango, samba, salsa et musique andine.


COMMENT NOUS AIDER
On a besoin de 5000 dollars pour les coÃ»ts de crÃ©ation et production ce qui inclu la conception scenographique et les honoraires des gens qui participent au projet, soi dans la creation artistique ou la production et gestion du projet. Votre aide est fondammental pour nous. 


Nous comptons dÃ©jÃ  avec le mentorat artistique de LE TRUNK COLLECTIVE, avec trois mois de soutien du programme JEUNES VOLONTAIRES et avec 50 heures de studio au MAI, MontrÃ©al, arts interculturels. 


L'OBJECTIF

Creer une piece de danse cosmique, (heu, jeu veut dire COMIQUE), ou peut-etre une comedie dansique (comme vous voulez) qui nous permettre enchanter et sensibiliser cette monde cruel et distraitÃ© aux realitÃ©s et l'histoire Latinoamericaine.

Cette spectacle spectaculaire se presenterai dans les festivales d'Ã©tÃ© 2012 Ã  la ville de MontrÃ©al, la province du QuÃ©bÃ©c, et pourquoi pas, autour du monde bouleversÃ©.
Avec votre aide, nous allons produier une oeuvre de renombre interplanetaire, quelquechose jamais vu ou imaginÃ©e, un Ã©clat de rire, saveur, et beautÃ©.

S'IL VOUS PLAIT, RENVOYEZ CETTE DEMANDE A VOS CONTACTS!


MERCI BEAUCOUP!

----


YOUR DONNATIONS HELPS THIS INDEPENDENT PROJECT TO BE CREATED

DESCRIPTION
Caramba is a comic spectacle of dance, theatre, and clowning that recounts the history of Latin America.
Two love-struck wanderers: Carmentea and Bonifacio, dance from their lost homeland to who knows where, to enchant us with their bodies, the neverending tragedy and infinite comedy of the ''latino''. A hysterical adventure to the rythms of salsa, samba, tango, and Andean music.

HOW TO SUPPORT US
So far we have received support in the form of artistic mentorship from LE TRUNK COLLECTIVE and a grant from the JEUNES VOLONTAIRES program of Employment Quebec as well as 50 hours of rehearsal space at the MAI, Montreal, intercultural arts.
A 5000 dollar budget would allow us to elaborate all aspects of this creation and production. Your help is fundamental to help us reach this goal.

OBJECTIVE
To create a piece of COSMIC dance (umm, I mean comic dance), or maybe a dansic comedy (whatever sounds better to you, really) that allows us to both enamour and raise the consciousness of this cruel and forgetful world to the realities and histories of Latin America.

This spectacular spectacle will be presented in festivals during the summer of 2012 in the city of Montreal, in the province of Quebec and, why not, all around this upside down world!
With your help and support, we will produce a work of interplanetary renown, never before seen or imagined, an explosion of laughter, flavour and beauty.

PLEASE PASS THIS REQUEST ON TO YOUR CONTACTS!

THANK YOU!

CARAMBA DANZA
