story:
Hi, We're Swarm Artist Residency!

Swarm Artist Residency is an artist’s retreat built by Chicago artists for Chicago artists. It is a sliding scale residency for people to come and do the work they often do not have time to commit to in the midst of three jobs, five rehearsals, commuting and grocery shopping.

This is a space for artists to do only the work they want to do, alongside other artists doing the same thing- all while enjoying a backdrop of beautiful Wisconsin farmland. 

What We Need 

We are asking our community for $2,500. This will help us: 

*Feed our community of artists: every night we have a large dinner to both feed our bellies, as well as reflect on the work we have done that day. It is a great way to unwind at the end of the day, build community, and enjoy a lovely summer evening.

*Purchase general supplies: No artist's retreat is complete without endless boxes of markers, paints, scissors, or canvases. We also need cleaning supplies, extension cords, bins for storage, and much more for basic operations. 

*Furnish our awesome house: We get to stay in a big farm house, however it is unfurnished. We need dishes, lamps, pots and pans, furniture, and a few other household items to make our house feel like a home. 

*Help fund a Swarm community member who would not otherwise be able to afford to attend Swarm (cost of attendance is on a sliding scale, and lunch and dinner are $5 per day)

The Impact

This will be Swarm Artist Residency's second summer of supporting Chicago Artists. Last summer we served 50 artists. As our community grows, we anticipate that this year we will serve at least 100 artists, if not more. We love being able to provide a safe, inspiring, and affordable place for people to commit to their projects. The time at Swarm allows people to create new collaborations, discover new parts of themselves and their ideas, and to take a moment to breathe. After returning home in August, we saw many new partnerships that were made at Swarm continue to grow and influence the Chicago arts scene throughout the year. 

Risks & Challenges

This is a sliding scale artist residency. We want to provide an affordable space so that we can reach the people who need it most. However, that can sometimes leave us reaching into our own pockets to cover costs of operation. We want to continue to be able to offer this very affordable model, but still need to do things like rent space, purchase supplies, and feed our artists. We are grateful for any support you can offer! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about Swarm Artist Residency! (Here's the link to our website!)
  • Attend a Swarm Fundraising Event! Here is a list of some upcoming events! 
  • If you have supplies you'd like to donate to our home, please contact us at swarmrez@gmail.com

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN SWARM! WE APPRECIATE YOUR TIME AND DONATION!
story_txt:
Hi, We're Swarm Artist Residency! Swarm Artist Residency is an artist’s retreat built by Chicago artists for Chicago artists. It is a sliding scale residency for people to come and do the work they often do not have time to commit to in the midst of three jobs, five rehearsals, commuting and grocery shopping.This is a space for artists to do only the work they want to do, alongside other artists doing the same thing- all while enjoying a backdrop of beautiful Wisconsin farmland.   What We Need  We are asking our community for $2,500. This will help us: 
*Feed our community of artists: every night we have a large dinner to both feed our bellies, as well as reflect on the work we have done that day. It is a great way to unwind at the end of the day, build community, and enjoy a lovely summer evening.
*Purchase general supplies: No artist's retreat is complete without endless boxes of markers, paints, scissors, or canvases. We also need cleaning supplies, extension cords, bins for storage, and much more for basic operations. 
*Furnish our awesome house: We get to stay in a big farm house, however it is unfurnished. We need dishes, lamps, pots and pans, furniture, and a few other household items to make our house feel like a home. 
*Help fund a Swarm community member who would not otherwise be able to afford to attend Swarm (cost of attendance is on a sliding scale, and lunch and dinner are $5 per day)
The Impact
 This will be Swarm Artist Residency's second summer of supporting Chicago Artists. Last summer we served 50 artists. As our community grows, we anticipate that this year we will serve at least 100 artists, if not more. We love being able to provide a safe, inspiring, and affordable place for people to commit to their projects. The time at Swarm allows people to create new collaborations, discover new parts of themselves and their ideas, and to take a moment to breathe. After returning home in August, we saw many new partnerships that were made at Swarm continue to grow and influence the Chicago arts scene throughout the year. 
    Risks & Challenges This is a sliding scale artist residency. We want to provide an affordable space so that we can reach the people who need it most. However, that can sometimes leave us reaching into our own pockets to cover costs of operation. We want to continue to be able to offer this very affordable model, but still need to do things like rent space, purchase supplies, and feed our artists. We are grateful for any support you can offer! 
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Spread the word about Swarm Artist Residency! (Here's the link to our website!)

Attend a Swarm Fundraising Event! Here is a list of some upcoming events! 

If you have supplies you'd like to donate to our home, please contact us at swarmrez@gmail.com   THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN SWARM! WE APPRECIATE YOUR TIME AND DONATION!

story:
Short Summary

Synopsis

It is in the spirit of Oscar Micheaux that we would like to create this traveling film/video studio and theater. By taking a classic airstream trailer; collaborating with multiple artists from several disciplines, as well as community artists,we will create a classic yet innovative oasis.

O.Michaeux is an airstream trailer that has been converted into an off-the-grid, sustainable, traveling film/video studio and pop-up theater. The trailer supports an Artist Residency program focused on underrepresented artists and filmmakers who wish to create radical works that engage with the community. Think of O.Micheaux as an opening; a calling; an exploration into and a celebration of the depths of the alternative and the underserved. This is one of the most important projects are team has had the opportunity to be a part of, we simultaneously  get to strengthen our artistic skills and be a part of building  wholesome communities, we ask for you support in a new avenue or art making and creative learning.

We are gearing up for our pilot expedition, scheduled for Summer 2014, in which we will travel across the U.S. to shoot a film, Rediscovering the Scientist, which focuses on diversity in the sciences. Right now our most pressing concern is securing funds and supplies for traveling.

Our project is designed to provide an educational oasis for underserved communities, powered by solar energy and providing an exemplary  success story of science fueling modern artistic practices. We offer free workshops, training and screenings based around sustainable art making.

DESCRIPTION:

Inspiration

Oscar Micheaux was one of the first film directors, and the first known African­American filmmaker. From 1919 to the end of his life in 1951 he toured the united states showing his own films, raising money, often while shooting and cutting his next projects. An original crowdfunder, Micheaux refused to accept that his skin should stop him from showing or making movies.

Features

The trailer will include one main editing station and hook­ups for other add on editing bays, customized compartments for film/video gear, a full kitchen, bathroom, and sleeping area, as well as a full screen and projector that will attach to the outside of the trailer for pop­up screenings.

The trailer will be completely off the grid featuring solar panels, composting toilet, bike generator, and will be refurbished with sustainable building materials and practices. Lydia Hicks the main designer of this project has a passion for environmental filmmaking and believes that creating an off the grid work space would allow environmental messages to be less hypocritical, while reducing production costs.

  • Introduce yourself and your background.

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get


Your support will help pay for the cost of construction and the cost of our travel for our maiden voyage.  We completely gutted and reconstructed  a 1974 Airstream so the project is huge! Its been a long struggle, but with your help we can make it happen!

Your support is greatly appreciated, if you can't donate please just share our story with your friends and family.

For all donations over $200 you get a private weekend in the Airstream. Go on a vacation or edit  film, the space is flexible so the choice is yours. For all donations over $500 you get an entire week in the airstream!

And remember all donors get a digital download of the Rediscovering the scientist!

story:
Short Summary

Weaving Nature is an artist collective formed by a textile artist, a furniture designer, a community artist and a writer. Weaving Nature will facilitate a participatory art workshop in the community of Guatavita in Cundinamarca, Colombia during August 2016. Weaving Nature will create spaces for addressing environmental and sustainability issues in the village of Guatavita through art making in the form of textiles and compost bins. This group makes active, socially engaged art through collaboration with local women artisans to build understanding and connection between art, space and community. 


What We Need & What You Get

Weaving Nature is an artist collective that won a grant from the California College of the Arts to develop a sustainable project in collaboration with women artisans, this project will recognize the roles people in community can play in shaping their environment by using art and design as a tool for positive change.

Our artist collective has the money to develop the project, however we are still in need of money for out plane tickets in order to develop this very relevant project in Guatavita, Colombia.

The Impact

This project creates spaces for learning and the facilitation of conversations that need to happen. This project provides learning tools and art making skills that can be practically sustained by the community. This project will provide resources, information, and implementation about sustainability, composting and permaculture.The zines are a result of accumulated knowledge from the natural dyeing workshop that was collectively practiced. The zines are a direct outcome from research with participants and are also a guide that can be shared and borrowed to spread information on sustainability, permaculture and food waste management. The compost bin will be a result of the collective learning, and will remain a physical reminder for the community’s potential to impact their environment. The resources provided during the lecture will also continue to be a tool for learning and exchange of information. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money for this project to happen, sharing or passing the word also helps!

story:
My Story

For over 20 years, I have had this dream – to create a female figure, a Modern Athena, at the scale of Michelangelo’s David. It seemed impossible, but in 2014, a friend from Georgia made me a unique offer. As part of an exchange for web services, he would pay me with a thousand pounds of Italian marble and alabaster. I accepted. I bought a set of steel chisels that were gathering dust in an art store, watched some instructional YouTube videos, and went to work teaching myself how to carve. When you’ve thought about something as long as I have, and you finally sit down to do it, it just flows out. In 2016, I spent a month in the city of Artists, the town of Pietrasanta, Italy, where Michelangelo himself once worked. There, I purchased proper carbide chisels, diamond rasps, and over 4,000 lbs of statuario marble - and had everything shipped back to Chicago.

The Modern Athena sculpture is to be seen as a symbol of female strength, beauty and wisdom - a modern woman. In the age of the “#MeToo” movement, female identity and power have emerged as fronts for social change. This large scale sculpture embraces our changing social dynamics in the hopes that the turmoil of change will eventually beget mutual prosperity. 

Why I Need Your Support

My project has qualified for a month-long residency in Athens, Greece this coming January. I have already completed a small scale model in clay that we cast into fiberglass to make it travel ready. In Athens, I will be working with a team of people to figure out the logistics of a 17 foot tall sculpture. I need to figure out answers to questions like, where will it go? how should it be exhibited? what is a sensible budget? and timeline? etc.

I am currently working on a four foot version in statuario marble from a 2,000 lb block. 

My goal is to raise $5,500 to cover:

Residency fees, travel expenses and food for the month. If additional funds are raised, I will be able to visit Italy and purchase more marble from the quarries in Carrara and have it shipped back to America. It took me nearly 3 years to use up the marble I purchased in 2016 in Italy. I have a wonderful series of wings that I carved and figurative artworks. I'm now left with 1 block of marble that is being used for the four foot version of the Modern Athena. 

About the Artist Residency in Athens

The Athena Standards Residency is a month-long studio artist residency program in the bustling metropolis of Athens, Greece. I feel that my professional development is integral to the Athena Standards Residency program. I look forward to having a shared studio space and working with art historian and curator Elizabeth Plessa and the rest of her team on my project. There will be scheduled studio visits, galleries of interest, openings, and museum shows. ASR also provides space for Athenian artists and recent graduates of the Athens School of Fine Arts, to encourage dialogue and collaboration between Greek artists and international artists-in-residence. 

Modern Athena Details

Why did I choose to focus on Athena? Female figures in sculpture are often rendered as either pious or sensual, but rarely as beautiful and strong women capable of defending themselves. Athena is one of the few goddesses in the Greek pantheon I really respect. She symbolizes wisdom, handicraft, and warfare but would wisely only go to war if absolutely necessary. I recently read that in her earliest renderings, Athena was either an owl herself or a bird goddess in general, neatly tying both my marble artwork series, wings and figures, together into one concept...

HAIR - Traditionally, Athena wore an amulet of a Gorgon, the scary Medusa snake head that turns people into stone... as a symbol of protection. I wanted the hair to resemble snakes along with braids and dreadlocks... on the carved marble version, light will filter thru the gaps in the hair as the light of reason that protects.

KNIFE - Growing up fishing, I always kept a knife on me, and in my solo travels in Europe and Asia, the tradition continued. When I lived in New Orleans during the evacuation for Hurricane Katrina, I had to entrust my favorite knife to a friend. She lost it, but a few months later a box appeared in the mail holding a Spanish Muela blade and a note...”There is a tradition in gift giving that requires the recipient of a knife to reciprocate with the gift of a coin. Presumably, this protects the strings of friendship from being cut by the blade.” Sadly, I let the friendship be cut and the knife sat for nearly a decade with a sheath maker. Last year when my friend took her life, my regrets deepened, and so the sculpture began with a gift that I didn’t appreciate until it was too late.

STATUARIO MARBLE - Marble is never uniform in color, each type is quarried and mined from a particular part of the mountain and these veins often mix into each other. Statuario is prized because of its seemingly white uniformity, but upon closer inspection it is full of traces of color and warmth. The sculpture should be seen as a symbol of fusion that includes the entire spectrum of color. 

TATTOO - The human desire to take flight and abandon this earth-bound condition is timeless. Our progress in the last 100 years is breathtaking, and yet still hampered by age old corruption. By creating a figurative sculpture, I am referencing the dichotomies of the human condition. However, I’m including a wing as a symbol of hope. Highly polished Statuario marble resembles living flesh. This illusion of flesh will be accentuated by a wing tattoo on her back painted in Chinese ink. It will be an incomplete wing akin to an unfinished message. It is a message that must be discovered and finished by the viewers themselves. It is, after all, our shared story.

Artwork Samples

Here are samples of my drawings and sculptures, and photos of me at work in my Chicago studio to give a better idea of the start to finish process of carving a marble sculpture.

Viola of Twelfth Night, Remnants Series, hand carved statuario carrara marble and chinese ink, H 14.5 x W 6 x D 7 inches 

Goddess Flora, Pair of Limestone Statues, private commission, hand carved Indiana limestone H 76 x W 24 x D 18 inches

Original Charcoal Drawings: Bird Wing 40x60 inches Figure & Fabric 30x80 inches

Latest Press & Website

Here are links to my most recent press

“In Michelangelo’s Footsteps,” by Alan Wechsler, Loyola Magazine, August 2019
“Hinsdale Library to stage story of famous Shanghai sisters,” by Sara Clarkson, Chicago Tribune, July 2019
“Around Town Visits Workshop 4200,” by Ana Belaval, WGN9 News, 2019
“LIFTED,” Documentary by Motion FilmWorks, 2018

 See more artwork at jylbonaguro.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't afford to personally give.  I would be so grateful if you would consider helping out in these other ways too: 

Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign

Share the link on your personal social pages

Special Thanks

To Andrea Mattson for being my muse, friend and model and to Ben Stroh for bearing with my passing out early on the couch from exhaustion for months and to all my friends and family I have neglected because of my absolute commitment to this dream of creating a sculpture at the scale of Michelangelo’s David. It’s finally beginning...

I live for my work. Your support is deeply appreciated and means everything to me.

story:
Hello!

It's Zelis & Leo!

We wanted to thank You for visiting The West 88 IndieGoGo site! We wanted to invite you to take a read! For further information regarding the venture plan, please feel welcome to contact.

Zelis@TheWest88.com



 

Hey, I also wanted to send this follow up. I had heard that it wasn't exactly clear on what we were doing. And anyone who is part of our audience or planning to donate deserves to be 100% clear. Please feel free to get back to me with any questions or concerns. Leo and I are constantly working in making a more concrete mission, and appreciate all feedback. 

Z. 

 

 

 The West 88

We create Events that  promote social development. 

 

What do you mean by social development?

We will focus on how food / health initiatives are able to work with entertainment to define positivity within and between cultures. This will serve as our entry point into cross medium collaborations. 

What do these events incorporate?

1.Create a visually and emotionally stimulating environment:

We use physical design (think like a theater for set design) and music, digital media, performance, and food. 

2. Find Unique partners to find new solutions to the needs of the event:

The West 88 forges collaborations with entrepreneurs in order to allow them a way to work their product into our event, giving them a creative and positive outlet into a social community.  Examples of this may also include a company that wishes to sponsor by providing the kitchen equipment, or an agency that would like to have their talent at the event. 

 

What is our Aim?

1. To facilitate active awareness

2. To encourage collaboration between entrepreneurs

3. To create opportunities for work during the run of the event

4. To engage the audience while linking them seamlessly to the positivity and possibilities of sustainable health.  

 

Who are these events for?

They are for you, to attend, enjoy, and learn something new about how to maintain a positive lifestyle or business practice. These events will afford The West 88 to travel to more remote and under priveleged areas.  

Why?

The West 88 believes the best way to connect people with important issues is through a stimulating and interactive environment. There are no forums or lectures, but through the joy of live entertainment and digital media our audiences begin to access social awareness and positivity. 

 

 

What Will We do to begin? 

In the Fall of 2013 The West 88 will begin operating with a project in Sweden that serves as a unique and progressive exploration of the collaboration between entertainment and health practices.  The premier focus is on creating mixed media and  cultural explorations, along with a unique theatrical culinary experience. Through the event we will address issues of income inequality in regard to food consumption, and the need for  an international food initiative similar to one started in Scandinavia:The Nordic Food Manifesto. Our Goal is to work with artists, chefs, and entrepreneurs in order to create a space that allows people to see the benefits of choosing and learning healthy food options by engaging with these practices in a fun and vibrant space. 

 

 The project is set on a large scale. Since the last trip to Scandinavia in January of 2012, The West 88 has steadily been making progress in obtaining international sponsorship.

 

 

About

The West 88 believes that art in its most basic and original form is the gathering of a group of peoples to spread knowledge and motivate one another to action. The West 88 creates this architecture for opportunity by developing interactive performative exhibitions that form community, encourage social activism, and permit cross cultural, global exchange.

By fusing interdisciplinary and international work The West 88 highlights an ability to create a platform that knows no average or type. Rather it is bound by the belief that accessibility and inclusivity are key in order to create entertainment as a sustainable practice in uniting people with the resources they need to access their potential. 

 

Why We need Your Help!

Zelis will be making a trip to Sweden the first two weeks of July in order to further artistic connections and acquire meetings with potential sponsors. This meeting is vital in confirming our plans for not only our projects in Sweden, but also for the long term trajectory of The West 88.

In order to make this trip happen, we are asking for your help!



What We Have

+ Positive Spirits

+ Ambition

+ Couchsurfing.org for housing arrangements

+ connections to build upon

+ Minimal time!



What We Need

+Airfare

+Local transportation

+Food

+Business portfolio

Total: 1500 USD



PERKS!

$1 Thank You! Let's have a coffee.

$10 : A public Thank You on our FB page (Facebook.com/TheWest88)

$20: A tap performance,oh yes- that's right, made just for you! Come see it live if you are in NYC or have it messaged to your inbox!

$50: A drink at The West 88, a good time is the guarantee.

$88:Welcome to Studio 88! Interviews with creatives met on our adventures are in this video database compiled! **Updated weekly: Enjoy Studio 88 for months to come**

$1000: Premium! You want to sponsor this trip! Thank You! We would love to offer the services of The West 88 to create a unique experience for you and your friends, drinks included. And don't forget all the awesome perks above.

The Impact

The donated funds will allow us to take the next step with the company and to create a global community in which entertainment serves as the catalyst to social and economic development. Your contribution will allow for The West 88 to advance in our work to:

+ fuel global entrepreneurship

+Create jobs in underexposed districts

+Empower and entwine the socially stigmatized in the general population

+Spread knowledge and access to sustainable business, family, and personal practices.

 

The Team

ZELIS

 

Hey, It's Zelis here. To understand The West 88 and my passion for gathering individuals it is vital I explain for you parts of myself. I was born in the now fallen city of Detroit, Michigan. Two days later I was adopted and taken to the bright San Francisco Bay Area to a quaint home at the end of a cul-de-sac that borders the main road into the city. Karen Zelis,my Mother, a district attorney and single mother raised both my elder brother and I here. Though she was the only independent mother and woman of color on the block, she served as show runner of the neighborhood and outward community. She has facilitated countless block parties, holiday events, athletic gatherings, cultural celebrations, community rallies and more. From time spent with my mother I have learned: to infuse creativity into ordinary or traditional activities, that to every problem there is a solution, and that any global goodness  begins in the community, between persons - a simple act of kindness. 

 

As my Mother knew the importance of inclusivity and community expansion, regardless of racial,gender,and social positioning; she encouraged this through the varying activities I was permitted to take on. I played in the boys youth baseball, basketball, and flag football leagues; competed in Odyssey of the Mind; performed in over twenty plays; danced tap and ballet; started a slam poetry group; explored passions in the kitchen; and took a year to develop a musical fundraiser in cooperation with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. At our home there have been over forty gatherings from my extracurricular activities alone. At an early age I learned that family is not about what we can hold together, but how we allow outside sources to permeate and influence the ever developing unit.

 

As I developed I found the theater to be the outlet to focus my energy and passion. The theater was a temple in which darkness rose to reveal a restart and a renewal in the faith I carried in myself through the cultures, places, and people that became close to my heart, imagined through the theater.

 

I have studied theater at Center REP, Berkeley REP, The Interlochen Arts Academy, Stella Adler, Stonestreet Studios, and The Atlantic Theater Company. Regardless of approach there ar e two constants in the theater: When I enter it is empty, when the performance concludes, the space is again bare. But be it after the first performance, the fourth, or the fortieth- each time I enter that empty space, even if to the same sequence of events, I am released transformed. The theatrical structure allowed me at a young age to experience cause and effect in a controlled and compelling environment.

 

The West 88 has taken this concept but instead of putting on a play as a theater company may work to master, The West 88 creates original mixed medium experiences that constantly aim to connect individuals, expand our imagination in coordination with creating for every chosen problem a sustainable solution.

 

The West 88 is the accumulation of my love for the family and my calling and distinct passion for the theater.; it is an extension of my ever expanding and regenerative soul; a call for a progressive world, in which peace is the creative confrontation of social and economic deprivation within and between communities.

 



 

 LEO

 

Hey it's me, Leo. I had been in Nnew York City from my home country of Brazil for barely three weeks when I met Zelis at Washington Square Park. I was then invited to tap in The West 88 To Spring exhibition and from that point became very involved with the ideas and passions of The West 88. Let's take a few steps back: I grew up in Piracicaba with my mother, father, and three brothers. When I was six years old I took my first ballet class. A year later I began to tap, and would never stop.

 

Though Tap is a distinctly American art, I found many opportunities afforded to me in Brazil. I was able to receive a full scholarship to a rigorous private school that had not before been a viable option. When I was twenty-one I moved to Rio de Janeiro and began performing on the street. Through my corner performances I was interviewed on Programa do Jo ( a Brazilian David Letterman.) I was also offered and performed a part in the musical La Cage Aux Folles.

 

I have found myself able to forge connections and opportunities in America. I have attended various workshops in California, and was able to work with Jennifer Lopez, Marc Antony, and Jamie King on the American reality tv show Que Viva.

 

Being a part of The West 88 is the most natural expansion of my career as an artist. It is my dream to work with tap and continue to extend the medium as a tool for international and musical collaborations. Without tap dance, I have no idea where I would be, it has been essential in allowing me to live and promote global exchange. Through The West 88 I know I will continue to share my love for Brazil and remain open and active as a member of this global community.

 

 

------

We hope you enjoyed your visit to The West 88 IndieGoGo site! We would love it if you would donate to our campaign, and like us on facebook! Facebook.com/TheWest88

 

Help us make dreams come true! 

Zelis & Leo
story_txt:
Hello!
It's Zelis & Leo!
We wanted to thank You for visiting The West 88 IndieGoGo site! We wanted to invite you to take a read! For further information regarding the venture plan, please feel welcome to contact.
Zelis@TheWest88.com

 
Hey, I also wanted to send this follow up. I had heard that it wasn't exactly clear on what we were doing. And anyone who is part of our audience or planning to donate deserves to be 100% clear. Please feel free to get back to me with any questions or concerns. Leo and I are constantly working in making a more concrete mission, and appreciate all feedback. 


Z. 
 
 


 The West 88
We create Events that  promote social development. 
 
What do you mean by social development?
We will focus on how food / health initiatives are able to work with entertainment to define positivity within and between cultures. This will serve as our entry point into cross medium collaborations. 
What do these events incorporate?
1.Create a visually and emotionally stimulating environment: 
We use physical design (think like a theater for set design) and music, digital media, performance, and food. 
2. Find Unique partners to find new solutions to the needs of the event:
The West 88 forges collaborations with entrepreneurs in order to allow them a way to work their product into our event, giving them a creative and positive outlet into a social community.  Examples of this may also include a company that wishes to sponsor by providing the kitchen equipment, or an agency that would like to have their talent at the event. 
 
What is our Aim?
1. To facilitate active awareness 
2. To encourage collaboration between entrepreneurs
3. To create opportunities for work during the run of the event
4. To engage the audience while linking them seamlessly to the positivity and possibilities of sustainable health.  
 
Who are these events for?
They are for you, to attend, enjoy, and learn something new about how to maintain a positive lifestyle or business practice. These events will afford The West 88 to travel to more remote and under priveleged areas.  
Why?
The West 88 believes the best way to connect people with important issues is through a stimulating and interactive environment. There are no forums or lectures, but through the joy of live entertainment and digital media our audiences begin to access social awareness and positivity. 
 
 
What Will We do to begin? 
In the Fall of 2013 The West 88 will begin operating with a project in Sweden that serves as a unique and progressive exploration of the collaboration between entertainment and health practices.  The premier focus is on creating mixed media and  cultural explorations, along with a unique theatrical culinary experience. Through the event we will address issues of income inequality in regard to food consumption, and the need for  an international food initiative similar to one started in Scandinavia:The Nordic Food Manifesto. Our Goal is to work with artists, chefs, and entrepreneurs in order to create a space that allows people to see the benefits of choosing and learning healthy food options by engaging with these practices in a fun and vibrant space. 


 
 The project is set on a large scale. Since the last trip to Scandinavia in January of 2012, The West 88 has steadily been making progress in obtaining international sponsorship.
 
 
About
The West 88 believes that art in its most basic and original form is the gathering of a group of peoples to spread knowledge and motivate one another to action. The West 88 creates this architecture for opportunity by developing interactive performative exhibitions that form community, encourage social activism, and permit cross cultural, global exchange.
By fusing interdisciplinary and international work The West 88 highlights an ability to create a platform that knows no average or type. Rather it is bound by the belief that accessibility and inclusivity are key in order to create entertainment as a sustainable practice in uniting people with the resources they need to access their potential. 
 
Why We need Your Help!
Zelis will be making a trip to Sweden the first two weeks of July in order to further artistic connections and acquire meetings with potential sponsors. This meeting is vital in confirming our plans for not only our projects in Sweden, but also for the long term trajectory of The West 88.
In order to make this trip happen, we are asking for your help!

What We Have
+ Positive Spirits
+ Ambition
+ Couchsurfing.org for housing arrangements
+ connections to build upon
+ Minimal time!

What We Need
+Airfare
+Local transportation
+Food
+Business portfolio
Total: 1500 USD

PERKS!
$1 Thank You! Let's have a coffee.
$10 : A public Thank You on our FB page (Facebook.com/TheWest88)
$20: A tap performance,oh yes- that's right, made just for you! Come see it live if you are in NYC or have it messaged to your inbox!
$50: A drink at The West 88, a good time is the guarantee.
$88:Welcome to Studio 88! Interviews with creatives met on our adventures are in this video database compiled! **Updated weekly: Enjoy Studio 88 for months to come**
$1000: Premium! You want to sponsor this trip! Thank You! We would love to offer the services of The West 88 to create a unique experience for you and your friends, drinks included. And don't forget all the awesome perks above.
The Impact
The donated funds will allow us to take the next step with the company and to create a global community in which entertainment serves as the catalyst to social and economic development. Your contribution will allow for The West 88 to advance in our work to:
+ fuel global entrepreneurship
+Create jobs in underexposed districts
+Empower and entwine the socially stigmatized in the general population
+Spread knowledge and access to sustainable business, family, and personal practices.
 
The Team 
ZELIS

story:
SPACED MEMORY

is a multimedia project by artist Elana Katz that documents the disappearance and erasure of Jewish sites of Eastern Europe during and since the Holocaust. These instances of historical erasure are a result of the Second World War, of post-war communist governments, and/ or of continuing anti-Semitism. They include an overwhelming number of cemeteries, synagogues, and buildings important to the Jewish community that were destroyed, built-over, desecrated, and now, whose history has simply been forgotten. SPACED MEMORY is comprised of research, photography, video, and site-specific performances that examine post-memory and absence at these sites of historical erasure. The work fosters sensitivity to the present through an historical lens, and calls attention to places where history has fallen silent.   

So far, this project has been a completely financially independent initiative! The project has generated a great deal of non-monetary support, but Elana needs resources in order to continue and complete the work that she has begun. The funds that YOU will help Elana to raise will make it possible to:

1. Spend a period of several months dedicated to intense research and creation of site-specific and responsive artwork in Romania and in Serbia (3 months maximum, respectively for each country).

2.  Travel within Romania and Serbia to find remote, non-urban, sites of historical erasure.

3.  Collaborate with an interpreter for this research, travel, and site-specific production process.

4. Archive collected photographic and video documentation material

5. Realize site-specific performances - a budget is needed for performance materials, performance documentation (photographer and videographer), and performance promotion.

Elana has already received invitations to present this work at multiple venues upon its completion, so once it is fully realized, it will reach international audiences through public artist talks, exhibitions, and publications.

JUST IN CASE the entire budget goal is not met, the funds raised will still facilitate a shorter period of research and, if a minimum budget of $4,900 USD is reached, this will finance the realization of at least 1 site-specific performance in Belgrade within the presentational frame of the non-profit organization the Rex Cultural Center.

SPACED MEMORY carries a distinct historical significance as the overwriting of these sites have, whether intentionally or not, effectively erased testimony of Jewish history at locations where there has also been a disappearance, or extreme diminishment, of Jewish population. Eastern Europe is the focus of this project as this was once home to substantial Jewish populations that have mostly disappeared since the Second World War -- SPACED MEMORY confronts the absence of Jewish subculture, and it’s memory, in the given societies.

PLEASE HELP with whatever donation you can afford, so that Elana can finally, after 2 years of personal financial investment, complete this project! Even if you cannot contribute at this time -- please help to spread the word!! 

....

Spaced Memory
WIDE ANGLE 



MARIANNE THEIL of the German-Romanian Society of Berlin makes a commentary on the significance of Elana Katz's Spaced Memory in Romania. 

.....

NEBOJSA MILIKIC of the REX Cultural Center of Belgrade, comments upon the collaboration between Elana Katz and REX, and the significance of Spaced Memory in Serbia. *View Video Here*

.....

Spaced Memory
IN FOCUS


Spaced Memory IN FOCUS:
Jewish Cemetery Niš, Serbia
Currently: Roma Settlement

This cemetery was in use until the Holocaust. In post-Holocaust Yugoslavia, the government offered the inactive cemetery to a local Roma community as a secure place to live. The Roma built homes on half of the cemetery and used the tombstones in the construction of the village. A portion of the cemetery was not built-over but instead was used as a garbage dump for the village. In post-communist Serbia, the dump section of the cemetery was given back to the Jewish Community of Niš by the municipality. Today, the former cemetery is thus divided between the Roma and the Jews. It is unfortunately, and ironically, a site of intense conflict between the two groups. SPACED MEMORY concerns itself with the complex overlay of Roma and Jewish cultures at this site. (Information collected from conversations with the Roma community, the Jewish Community of Belgrade and Niš, and the archives of the Jewish Historical Museum of Belgrade).

....

Donation GIFTS include sneak-peak virtual tours of found sites, limited edition SPACED MEMORY postcards, archival photographic prints, and selections from other performance works: paintings from Color Me Clear (2011), rubbings from Unnamed (2013), and, at every giving level - lots of THANK YOUs!

New GIFT: Yoga Lessons
Elana Katz is also a yoga teacher and a dedicated yoga practitioner. She has been teaching yoga in Berlin since 2009, and has additionally lead workshops and classes as an invited guest teacher in Japan and the United States. Donations GIFTS include free passes to Elana's weekly yoga classes in Berlin, and customized 90minute private online yoga lessons - which can accommodate anyone, anywhere in the world. Cultivate your sense of inner calm with a yoga practice as a donation gift.

.....

 Peak at selected performance works included in donation gifts (further info can be found in the SPACED MEMORY campaign gallery):

.....

....


About the artist:

ELANA KATZ is a Jewish-American conceptual artist currently based in Berlin, Germany, working primarily in the mediums of performance art and photography. Working often from a historical basis, Elana Katz’s work confronts cultural conventions, critically examines the complexity that lies within contradictions, and thus aims to create an experience of unlearning the assumed.

Katz attended the Parsons School of Design in New York, and completed graduate studies with a "Meisterschuelerin" title at the University of Arts Berlin (UdK Berlin), in the class of Katharina Sieverding. Her recent grants have included the DAAD Graduate Studies Grant (2010) and the Franklin Furnace Fund (2011). She participated as a re-performer at Marina Abramovic’s retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art in New York (2010), and has recently exhibited/ performed at the Abramovic Studio, Location One, New York (2011), Royal Museum of Fine Arts of Belgium (2011), Freies Museum Berlin (2012), P.P.O.W. Gallery, New York (2013) and Diehl CUBE, Berlin (2013).

http://www.elana-katz.com/

Contact: katz.performance@gmail.com

....

Campaign credits:

SPACED MEMORY Indiegogo Campaign Video Production and Editing: Branka Pavlovic

Video performance shots:

Clear Soap, 2013, Camera: Carlos Detres, Sponsored by Emporio dei Giovani

Auf Mein Sheitel, 2012, Camera: Melissa Longenecker

Color Me Clear, 2011, Camera: Ron Littke

Dust Path, 2012, Camera: Ivana Todorovic

Wash Empty, 2013, Camera: Nikola Radic Lucati

Red Tape, 2013, Camera: Iulia Mocanu

Music:

"Ghostpocalypse - 6 Crossing the Threshold" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

"On the Passing of Time" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

Schubert: Sonata in B flat major; Wandererfantasie, Mvt. 2.  Andante sostenuto, played by Vladimir Ashkenazy, 1987

Special thank you to SPACED MEMORY consultants: Paul Katz, Martha Strongin Katz, Michelle Katz, Philip Metz, Branka Pavlovic, Nebojsa Milikic, Sonia Simmenauer, Volker Diehl, and Eleonora Frolov.

story:
ZEPPELIN LZ-13 / ART CAR / BURNINGMAN 2013

 

Short Summary

We are Anne Staveley and Steve Dulfer, mixed media artists and entrepreneurs living in Santa Fe, New Mexico. We work in metal, photography, fabric, and any other bits and pieces that catch our fancy. 

We've got a plan to fly a zeppelin around the Playa at Burning Man 2013 and with your help, it might just work!

Our dream is to mutate a battered old golf cart into a miniature airship and dive into the tremendous outpouring of creativity that blooms in Nevada's Black Rock Desert for one week each year.

 

Steve:  

For me, this is a once-in-a-lifetime chance to bring an art car to my first time at Burning Man.  Zeppelins have fascinated me since I was a kid.  They were so big, so fragile, so foolishly flammable!  Building one, even if it's a little one, is something I've always wanted to do.

 

Anne:  

It's about the magic of taking something from my imagination, and then seeing it there in front of me.  It's a fantasy object-it's like science fiction coming to life. I'm inspired to create all the details-the upholstery, the dials, the wheels.  I'm excited for the adventures we'll find along the way..

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here it is in living color (or is it black and white?):

We're raising $3500 to make our long-suffering golf cart (Yolanda) live again, turn it into a miniature illuminated (and thoroughly non-flammable) zeppelin, transport it from Santa Fe to Nevada's Black Rock Desert, and bring it safely home again.  Specifically, we need batteries and tires for the cart.  We need steel, plywood, fabric, upholstery foam, construction supplies,and lots of cool lighting for  Yolanda's zeppelin hat.

Since we're both artists, we're offering original art as rewards for your participation in our project.  Signed photographs from the Playa, commemorative LZ-13 stainless steel necklaces, and even Zeppelin belt buckles.  Also, for a lucky few, sunset champagne cruises aboard LZ-13 herself.  Check out the full description ON RIGHT.

We're really committed to bringing our zep to Burning Man 2013--we've been planning the project for over a year.  So we'll invest every cent you donate towards making it happen, even if we don't reach our goal of $3500.

 

The Impact

We want LZ-13 to be a creation of whimsy and of beauty, and for her to inspire curiosity, delight, and cameraderie.  And in appreciation for your support, we'd like to share her with you.

We can make this happen.  We've supported ourselves as artists and entrepreneurs for more than ten years. We're excited and we're ready. 

As crowdfunding proposals go, ours is pretty modest.  And yet, without your donations, it just won't happen.  Help us turn our magical dream into reality and LZ-13, fleeting illusion that she is, will touch the lives of hundreds of people in real ways that we can't even begin to predict.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is ...

 

Thanks so much,

Anne & Steve
story_txt:
ZEPPELIN LZ-13 / ART CAR / BURNINGMAN 2013
 
Short Summary
We are Anne Staveley and Steve Dulfer, mixed media artists and entrepreneurs living in Santa Fe, New Mexico. We work in metal, photography, fabric, and any other bits and pieces that catch our fancy. 
We've got a plan to fly a zeppelin around the Playa at Burning Man 2013 and with your help, it might just work!
Our dream is to mutate a battered old golf cart into a miniature airship and dive into the tremendous outpouring of creativity that blooms in Nevada's Black Rock Desert for one week each year.
 
Steve:  
For me, this is a once-in-a-lifetime chance to bring an art car to my first time at Burning Man.  Zeppelins have fascinated me since I was a kid.  They were so big, so fragile, so foolishly flammable!  Building one, even if it's a little one, is something I've always wanted to do.
 
Anne:  
It's about the magic of taking something from my imagination, and then seeing it there in front of me.  It's a fantasy object-it's like science fiction coming to life. I'm inspired to create all the details-the upholstery, the dials, the wheels.  I'm excited for the adventures we'll find along the way..
 


What We Need & What You Get
Here it is in living color (or is it black and white?):
We're raising $3500 to make our long-suffering golf cart (Yolanda) live again, turn it into a miniature illuminated (and thoroughly non-flammable) zeppelin, transport it from Santa Fe to Nevada's Black Rock Desert, and bring it safely home again.  Specifically, we need batteries and tires for the cart.  We need steel, plywood, fabric, upholstery foam, construction supplies,and lots of cool lighting for  Yolanda's zeppelin hat.
Since we're both artists, we're offering original art as rewards for your participation in our project.  Signed photographs from the Playa, commemorative LZ-13 stainless steel necklaces, and even Zeppelin belt buckles.  Also, for a lucky few, sunset champagne cruises aboard LZ-13 herself.  Check out the full description ON RIGHT.
We're really committed to bringing our zep to Burning Man 2013--we've been planning the project for over a year.  So we'll invest every cent you donate towards making it happen, even if we don't reach our goal of $3500.
 


The Impact
We want LZ-13 to be a creation of whimsy and of beauty, and for her to inspire curiosity, delight, and cameraderie.  And in appreciation for your support, we'd like to share her with you.
We can make this happen.  We've supported ourselves as artists and entrepreneurs for more than ten years. We're excited and we're ready. 
As crowdfunding proposals go, ours is pretty modest.  And yet, without your donations, it just won't happen.  Help us turn our magical dream into reality and LZ-13, fleeting illusion that she is, will touch the lives of hundreds of people in real ways that we can't even begin to predict.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is ...
 
Thanks so much,
Anne & Steve

story:
The Show

Every artist has a process that brings them from the birth of an idea to the completion of a work. Many movement artists utilize objects as tools to inspire their movement, then later discard these objects and let the movement reign. Then there are those of us who start to see the object as a co-performer, as a friend, as a partner and sometimes as an enemy. This show celebrates those objects and the contribution they have brought to the creation of this series of performance-based works.


Object as Performer will be a two-night performance and gallery show in Brooklyn, NY with performance, video and installation work by Rebecca Davis, MartÃ­n Lanz, Abigail Levine, Juri Onuki, The A.O. Movement Collective, Nina Schwanse and Felisia Tandiono.


The show is taking place February 3&4 at CPR-Center for Performance Research.


Where your money will go

As the curator of this show, I'm seeking support to pay the artists for their contribution, to acquire necessary event insurance, to hire a stage manager who will keep the show on task, and various other production-related costs. All of the funds will go directly back into the creation of this show.


Your contribution will also assist in the printing of Object as Performer: The Book. This book is a collection of photos and essays by the artists that allows for an insight into their creative process when developing object-based work. 


Funding goal

The $2,000 goal is a minimum amount to make this show happen. This campaign will remain active for three weeks after the show closes as a way for people who attended the show to make a contribution and also to as an outlet for those interested in purchasing Object as Performer: The Book.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with others! 
  • If you're in the New York area, come to the show on February 3 or 4

story:
No More Under-Served Children!  Let Time In's Art Birds Fly!

Give what you can and show that you care! 

Whether it's $10 or $10,000!

YOUR DONATION  goes directly into the hands of some of the city's most at-risk children:  art supplies, tons of studio time, making, seeing, dancing, singing in one of the most exciting and sophisticated arts programs in the world.  

YOUR DONATION goes directly to the hearts of children:   Working one on one with some of the country's leading up-and-coming artists, our children's hearts are bolstered knowing that someone amazing is there for them, week after week, and really cares!  

YOUR DONATION goes directly into the beautiful, growing minds of children bringing them a culture of intelligence and beauty that is powerful enough to help them believe that THEY can change the world . . . AND THEY WILL!!!
 

ART BIRDS.  HELP US SOAR.   Changing the world through the arts  - one beautiful child at a time!

The Time In Children's Arts Initiative is a 501c3.  No need to ask:  We'll send you a receipt for your amazingly generous support of our kids!

story:
Totem, Notem, Tonem is a giant 20 foot tower with magical hidden compartments of spirit animal wonders inside and out! A large stack of vintage luggage compiles to make the totem tower. The totem is adorned with portals, cranks, gears, sprockets, springs,a gold bird with wind propelled wings, and a helix corkscrew wind chime chandelier on the inside is as much interactive as it is thought-provoking. The sculpture is colorfully scrolled with wood carvings of spirit animals from the Pacific Northwest which signify its meaning of reconciliation between man and mother earth. The sculpture towers over an observer while compelling one to crawl inside to sit within the ambiance of the sculpture and listen to the beautiful chimes during the day. Totem, Notem, Tonem at night becomes eerie and fierce as the eyes of the spirit animals are illuminated and the interior of the sculpture flickers with candles of mysticism. As you can see below, because of the amazing crew and Priscilla's relentless desire to create a sacred space within a sculpture it is well worth the time, effort, and donation.

 

 

 

This colorfully scrolled art piece is an honorarium project for Burning Man, 2013, which means that it received a grant for approximately 50% of the cost of the project. The artist is expected to fundraise the additional money needed to bring the project to the desert in August of 2013, which is why we are reaching out to you! The great news is that the project has been able to use reclaimed materials whenever possible during construction. Therefore, the money raised now is for paint, the convex glass windows, and transportation.

This awesome sculpture is like a totem pole, jack-in-the-box, music box so if you make it to Burningman this year please crawl inside the sculpture and sit around the fire with us as we gaze up at the moving gears and pulleys and listen to the amazing chime chandelier…

Thank you Bunches for taking the time to consider supporting this project. We believe it takes a village to make good art and because of that at any level of donation we will engrave your name or a loved one's name of your choice onto the ceiling of the sculpture. Everyone visiting the art piece will see all who gave and allowed the sculpture to come to fruition. We apologize for the lack of video but we are putting all our energy into getting this sculpture built and on the playa. We believe the images are breath taking enough and we know it will be enjoyed.

The sculpture will be complete by the end of July and transported the second week of August. The crew is putting just as much love into the sculpture as into the donation swag. So enjoy which ever art piece swag you end up with.


 

See All Images of Donation Swag in Gallery Tab Above.

Priscilla aka Scilla and the crew has worked past playa projects such as Breaking Wave and Tree of Life and as such has a wealth of experience with the endless issues that come up at the last minute and how to creatively solve them. 

Burningman although dusty, an amazing place to build art. Thank you immensely!!

story:
Hi! My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a Romanian self-publisher and blogger. I've been writing for over eight years now, but I've only decided to release my stories to a wider audience in April 2012, when I also launched my blog.

So far I have released four novels, four short stories, a novella, a collection of short stories, written with Anca Dunavete, and a compilation of essays on art and writing.

As a blogger, I have written almost 400 posts. In October 2012 I decided to found irevuo, whose aim was to promote independent artists of all backgrounds and ages and so on.

What I Need & What You Get

Simply put, the money raised through this campaign will go in two directions:

  • Towards financing my final release for 2013, Happiness - funds are needed to pay for editing, promoting, advertising, and marketing. Basically, ensuring the final product looks professional and reaches a big enough audience.
  • Towards keeping my blog alive: domain renewal and all the other upgrades that have to be renewed once a year.

The Impact

I'm a self-publisher by choice. An independent artist who does all the work himself, and tries his best to make a living out of it.

And, believe it or not, I know how difficult and frustrating the world of self-publishing can be sometimes, especially when books aren't selling very well, despite the overall positive feedback from readers.

That's why the money raised will go towards helping me reach a bigger audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help out. You can make some noise for this campaign by tweeting and sharing our campaign page. You can write a blog post about this campaign. You can tell your friends about it, and you never know where help my come from.

story:
Who I am, What I'm Doing

My name is Perry Baron Huntoon and I am a painter moving to New York City!

I have been living, working and making art in Western Massachusetts for over 8 years.  In my time here I have participated in solo and group shows and benefited immensely from the nurturing and supportive artist community.  For the last two and a half years, I have worked as an arts administrator for a national arts service organization, in which I have developed as a professional while gaining a wider perspective on the arts.  My time in Western Mass has been incredibly valuable, but I feel it's time to move onto somewhere that I can fully realize my potential as an artist.

I have received a Clowes Fellowship to attend a month-long artist residency at the Vermont Studio Center, rising above hundreds of other applicants.  This residency will take place from September 29th-October 25th.  It will be a chance for me to live and breathe my artwork in a way I've never experienced before.  I will have my own private studio that I can work in 24 hours a day, and be surrounded by artists from all over the world.

After my residency, I plan on moving to New York City, where there are infinite opportunities for artists: galleries, alternative spaces, residencies, the best museums in the world, and thousands of other serious artists. 

Professional Goals I hope to Realize in NYC:

  • Find day job(s) in which I am surrounded by art and/or art-making, i.e. art or museum education, or other work in a gallery, museum or alternative art space
  • Develop a network of New York-based artists with whom to collaborate and share resources
  • Participate in more artist residencies
  • Long-term: Be able to support myself, at least partially, through sales/commissions of my artwork

In November I will be staying with friends in Brooklyn while I look for an apartment, interview for jobs, scope out studio space, and meet other artists in the city.  My goal is to be employed and living in my own place by December 1st.

The money I am raising through this campaign will help me continue the momentum I develop during my residency and allow me the time to network and find opportunities that are in line with my goals as an artist.  Having financial security in the first month I'm in the city will be the first step to finding my niche in the Big Apple and growing my career.

Where's Your Money Going, and What do You Get?

The $3,000 you help me raise will match my current savings to go toward my November living expenses as well as professional development opportunities.

One Month of Living Expenses Includes:

  • Groceries ($400)
  • Cell phone bill ($90)
  • Student loan payments ($200)
  • Initial payment on an apartment ($2,000-$3,000)

One Month of Professional Development Includes:

  • Subway fare to meet arts professionals and artists, visit organizations I'm interested in and attend workshops ($112)
  • Taking artists and professionals to lunch in order to pick their brains ($25/meal)
  • Professional development workshops such as NYFA's "Doctor's Hours for Visual Artists" ($25/session) or a business development class at 3rd Ward Brooklyn ($499)
  • Application fees for residency programs (Varies)


This piece, entitled Turning Point, depicts two very disparate landscapes: the Arctic and the American Southwest, is acrylic on canvas and measures 30x36".  I completed it in August of 2013 with this transition in the forefront of my mind. 

The more you give, the more of my art you can own, like signed prints, postcards, and even custom paintings of your favorite place.  You even have the chance to consult with me on your very own custom landscape.  Take a look at some of the the goodies that could be yours:

Thank You for Your Help

Thank you so much for considering a donation to this campaign and for believing in my dreams.

You can also participate by sharing this campaign with your friends using the social media sharing tools above!  And if you live in New York and need a roommate, let's talk!

story:
Why This Project?

Signature Series Book Project is about producing a one of a kind 18” x 24” book, consisting of 100 paintings which is a culmination of over 30 years of paintings. The book will be auctioned to the highest bidder and the proceeds will be donated to the SickKids Foundation Caribbean Project.The SickKids Foundation Caribbean Project is aimed to improving diagnoses and out comes for children affected by cancer and serious blood disorders, in the Caribbean. The Signature Series Book Project is one of many fundraising activities by various groups, organizations and individuals seeking to provide medical aid in the Caribbean.  The proceeds will go towards help build health care capacity in seven Caribbean countries; Jamaica, Barbados, Trinidad & Tobago, Bahamas, St. Vincent & Grenadines and the Bahamas.


Facts about Paediatric Cancer and Blood disorders in the Caribbean

The project was launched in Toronto on February 14, 2013 and in Jamaica on March 19, 2013 on behalf of the six participating Caribbean countries.

"There is, arguably, at least a 20-year-gap in survival rates [of victims of cancer] between Canada and many countries in the Caribbean," Professor Allen said.

"For some countries that gap might even be 40 years," he added.

"The infrastructure as it exists at most hospitals doesn't have sufficient isolation facilities for this population who are more prone to infection. Many promising therapies that have made a difference in outcome overseas are not available locally,"

This is supported by SickKids, whereby, the website outlines that unlike in Canada, countries across the Caribbean do not have a health-care system in place to support optimal management of pediatric cancer -- from proactive screening to early diagnosis and fast intervention.

There is only ONE pediatric cancer doctor on the entire island of Jamaica with a population of 3 million?

As an artist I believe that this is the best and most productive way I want to use my talent to serve humanity  

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am campaigning for $18,959.36; the funds will be used for:
  • Printing of original art work onto high quality photographic paper (each signed by the artist)
  • Transferring art work from negative to positive images
  • Creating a 18 x 24 book comprised of 100 black and white paintings (the book cover and inside back cover will consist of original drawings)
  • Designing the front cover to include a high quality silver chain around the edges of the cover
  • The bounding of the book
  • Technical support costs
  • Informing people about the unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Should I not raise the total amount through Indiegogo, I will seek other avenues to raise the total amount in order to reach my objective in creating Signature Series Book.

    • Your full financial support is critical in helping me meet my objectives

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can’t contribute, you can still help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!!
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!!

    The Signature Series: Fine Art Graphic Book will expose my long-standing love affair in creating black and white paintings.

    My paintings are influence by:

    • Music
    • Street Fashion
    • World Culture
    • Community
    • Youth Urban Culture  

    We sincerely thank you for your contributions and support!

story:
Hi, my name is Jenine Shereos and I am a visual artist specializing in fiber and textile techniques. In 2006, after completing my master’s degree in the fibers program at California State University, Long Beach, I moved to Boston Massachusetts, and since that time, I have been developing several new bodies of work, including the Leaf series and the Lacework series.

The Leaf Series

The leaf series was inspired by a collection of delicate leaf skeletons that I came across while hiking in northern California several years ago. In this work, I attempt to recreate the intricacies of a leaf’s veining using a system I developed by wrapping, stitching, and knotting together strands of human hair. I begin by stitching individual strands of hair by hand into a water- soluble backing material. At each point where one strand of hair intersects another, I stitch a tiny knot, so that when the backing is dissolved, the entire piece holds its form.

Creating this work is a very meditative process for me. I am attracted to the idea of transformation and the way that humble materials can be used to make something strangely beautiful and unexpected. The complex network of lines present in this work mimics the organic patterns found in nature and speaks to the natural systems of transformation, growth and decay. Allusions to the vascular tissue of plants, as well as the vascular system of the human body, exist simultaneously; the delicate trace of a hair falling silently, imperceptibly, from one’s head becoming the veins of a leaf as it falls from a tree leaving its indelible imprint on the ground below.

The Lacework Series

Another series I have been working on recently involves making lace patterns by tracing the shadows of trees. Recently, I have traced a number of tree shadows at Harvard’s Arnold Arboretum here in Boston.  As I sit down to draw the shadows, they are constantly shifting and in the course of the hour or two that it may take to capture a tree’s single shadow, numerous slips and shifts have occurred. I am interested in this process of attempting to capture something that is ultimately ephemeral. In the current phase of this project, I am exploring possible ways to interpret the information gathered by the tracings through various textile techniques.

CAMAC

In addition to my studio practice, for the past four years I have also been working full-time as a weaving teacher for adults with disabilities at Gateway Arts in Brookline MA. At Gateway, I assist artists as they work towards their goals in weaving and fiber arts. While I love my work at Gateway, balancing my own artistic practice with a full-time teaching position has been very challenging. I find myself longing for a quiet space outside of everyday life to reflect and create; and to reconnect with my own artistic practice.

This summer, I have been accepted for a month-long artist residency at the prestigious CAMAC Centre d'Art in Marnay-sur-Seine, France. Located in a small village just 60 miles outside of Paris, I will have the opportunity to focus on my artwork in the serene setting of the French countryside while also venturing into Paris to soak in artistic inspiration from the galleries and museums. During my time at CAMAC, I plan to continue work on the Leaf and Lacework series’ and also to begin developing new ideas. I eagerly anticipate this time of inspiration and reflection, and know that it will breathe new life into my creative process.

I am so excited about this opportunity, but I need your help to make it a reality! The funds raised on Indiegogo will go towards the cost of the residency program as well as transportation to and from France. Any additional funds raised for this project will go towards development and documentation of new work upon my return from the residency. I am offering archival quality matted and framed digital prints of images from the Leaf series as a thank-you for your support. Any amount that you can contribute would be greatly appreciated. Even if you are unable to make a donation, you can help by spreading the word! Thank you so much for taking the time to learn more about my campaign.

For Further information about my artwork, please visit:

Artist website

Artist Interview

LA Times Article

story:
GET YOUR HEART ON 

Heart On Calendar:
This will be our 2nd Annual Ladies of Heart On Calendar, Celebrating 5 years of Art & music events as a community.

Heart On Collective founded in January 2009 by Martha Carrillo, a Visual Artist, designer & mother. Originally conceived as a monthly event showcasing women working as local DJ's and Visual Arists, Heart On Grew to include live bands, vendors, spoken word, & various other entertainers. Creating a community that nurtures the imaginations of its participants & audience. 

Last years Calendar was Beautiful & this one is Guaranteed to be 10 times better! Please support us by sharing, reposting & inviting friends to our PRE-Sale party. Buy a calendar for you, your family and friends. Join the ART revolution.


SUPPORTING HEART ON

By Purchasing this calendar you are supporting our vision for 2014 & beyond. Each calendar month features an art installation/Concept featuring a models/ who are also Local Artists themselves. We need buco dollars ASAP!! Your donations will be going towards the production of the calendar. The desired goal for the calendar is $3000.  

  • Donation will go towards print, production and distribution.   
  • Perks, perks and more perks for each level of contribution. 
  • Per your request if this will be gifted to someone you will receive a certificate that your gift was purchased and delivered.  
  • Every penny counts and if goal isn't reached the funds will still go towards the calendar.  

HEART ON Impact

Your contribution not only helps fund the calendar, but it also goes towards other Heart On endeavors:

  • Organizing artistic showcases and exhibits
  • Community art programs 
  • Future calendar 

Other ways to help HEART ON 

VOLUNTEERS needed:
if youd like to join the crew & help us out with production, please email me at madeofdeadstars@gmail.com


Artists and Models

There is a featured artist and model for each month.  Each artist and model are hand picked local L.A. artists. Each artist was asked to create their own unique vision and artistic style to contribute for their designated month. No month is the same, each one is original and highlights the artists personality.  Below is a list of artists and models. 

JANUARY: ARTIST: FLOR QUINTO:MARTHA CARRILLO MODEL: SHIZU SALDAMANDO 

FEBRUARY: ARTIST: MARISSA MAGDALENA SYKES/ MODEL: FLOR QUINTO

MARCH: ARTIST: ERIK VIJELJIC/ MODEL: JANET RAMIREZ

APRIL: ARTIST/MODEL: MARTHA CARRILLO

MAY: ARTIST: JULIAN MONTELONGO/ MODEL: SHERRY LYNN

JUNE: ARTIST: MICHAELVINCENT GARCIA/ ARTIST: SORAYA MEDINA

JULY: ARTIST/MODEL: MARISSA MAGDALENA SYKES

AUGUST: ARTIST: CURLY VEE/ MODEL: JESS DIAZ

SEPTEMBER: ARTIST: SIMON SOTELO/ MODEL: TRAVIS READ-DAVISON

OCTOBER: ARTIST: ANDRU OOGAM/ MODEL: MARTHA CARRILLO 

NOVEMBER: ARTIST: LEO GALLEGOS/ MODEL: SIMON SOTELO

DECEMBER: ARTIST: SHERRY LYNN/ MODELS: KOLA: LETICIA WHITE


HEART ON Links 

Pre-Sale Party Invite: https://www.facebook.com/events/531722113591073/
Heart On Production Page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Heart-On-Production/128413050521075
Civic Center Studios: http://civiccenterstudios.com/
Self Help Graphics: http://www.selfhelpgraphics.com/

Share, share and share some MORE!!!
  • Share this link on Twitter, Facebook, or Emails some friends. 
  • Send someone a *hint* with this link that you'd like this as a gift for anytime and any day.  
  • Per your request if this will be gifted to someone you will receive a certificate that your gift was purchased and delivered.

story:
Woodcarving is my passion
Since more than 20 years I'm a woodcarver on this beautiful island La Gomera. I've always been working with recycled wood from broken branches and dead trees. Carving spoons and bowls and sculptures.
I love trees and got very much inspired by living and working in midst of nature.
Really it's a dream realized. We never got rich, but it's a privilege to love my work.
Since 3 years economic crisis in Spain is pushing me to find new horizons out there in the world. I've been travelling around Europe to find a new place to realize my creation and working here and there to make some money.

When the fire came
In August 2012 a big bushfire burnt many of the island's forest and came to our house burning down the bathroom and my workshop. Flames 20 meters high melted glass and aluminum and all of my tools, workbenches, all the craftwork and many sculptures, our photovoltaic equipment and so many things were converted to glooming ashes.

The solar panels of my photovoltaic equipment exploded in the fire, the batteries melted

It was quite a miracle the rest of the house was so little affected.
By now we built a new bathroom and restored the old workshop transforming it into a guestroom. By the way : it's much more beautiful, than it was before.
I also found a new place , where I want to start carving wood again.
Here is where you can help me.

3 big carved bowls survived the fire. Now I offer them as a reward for your support.
(in front : cypress , middle : elmtree , back : chestnut ) Have  a look in the updates on top of the page for individual fotos.
The middle one , made of elmtree wood has already gone to Switzerland.

Phoenix rising from the ashes
Good woodcarving tools are expensive and I need everything. Starting with a simple jetcut-saw, axes, gouges. The more money we will be able to raise, the better equipment I can afford. Machines like chainsaws, bandsaws, anglegrinders, flex-shaft drills are costy, but make life much easier. They help me to realize much more tricky and interesting projects.
So if there's little money it'll be simple and if there's loads of money I'll make a great woodcarving party.

These are the 10 sculptures I offer as a reward for BIG help. For better choice ask for individual fotos. The first one has the greatest choice !

Sharing the magic of La Gomera
Though I'm planning to build my new workshop in a different place for economic and social reasons we want to keep our little magic house in the mountains of La Gomera.
During the years we have put so much love restoring an old stone ruin that it has become a very special place, perfect for retreats enjoying peace and nature.
It's located just at the foot of a sacred mountain with wide views over the western part of the island and the Atlantic Ocean. The sunsets should be famous, but there are so few people up here.
Our decision to transform the former workshop into a guest room was to share this place with our friends and friends to be.

Please , also have a look at the updates on top of the page . There's a lot of interesting stuff I keep on sharing with you.

Thank You

Life is wonderful. And we are here to share with each other. As you help me realizing my dreams I offer to you my treasures, which is my creativity. To everybody who sees or shares this page I give my Thank You and I wish you well . Another way to contribute to my campaign is to leave a comment , whatsoever. This increases the traffic on my page and makes it more visible in indiegogo.

Those who decide to share their wordly riches (money) can choose the following options:

10 €

A video of my sculptures

I will send you via e-mail a small video with a selection of my sculptures.

20 €

Your name

As soon as I have my new workshop installed there will be a board with your name handcarved. This is the place of my new workshop :

The place is called Gühlitz,Küsten in the north of Germany. I will love to see you there.

Here will be my new workshop. It's very spacy, so I can really enjoy working and share my creation with you.

Back view of the house.

This is the main house. There is  a lot of space for working, exposing, celebrating and our friends to come.

30 €

A night in our million stars hotel

In the mountains of La Gomera, Canary Islands. La Dehesa,7 on 1050m above seelevel

It's a magic place in the middle of wild nature , at the foot of sacred mountain La Fortaleza. Great place for retreats in silence far away from civilization.

Our small guest room has a small kitchen and the bathroom is nearby. Best is to contact ,when you want to come to check who is at home and can attend you. Make your reservation. Sometimes a lot of people want to come.

Here are some fotos:

General view of our house with guest room at right.

View of guestroom

150 €  

5 nights in the eagles nest

It's the same guestroom like the one before, but it's 5 nights. Stars shining bright above me,sunsets, open sky, wide landscape with the Atlantic Ocean at your feet.

Please make your reservation.

300 €

A big carved bowl

Almost all of my craftwork was burnt into ashes. Only 3 big carved bowls survived the fire. Now I offer them to very generous people, who help me buy new tools. They are made of recycled 1st quality wood from canary islands.

The middle one has already gone to Switzerland. Please choose one of the others.

As  I live up in the mountains the next post office is about 1 hour away from my home. Still I will send your bowl next day after receiving the money. Please have a look at the individual fotos in the updates on top of this page and choose the one you like most.

500 €

A sculpture of your choice

For those of you who feel very generous and have fallen in love with my work I have selected 10 sculptures as a reward for very big help. You can choose the one you like most from the foto . I will be publishing individual fotos in the updates and you please feel free to ask for more.



If you want to contribute to my campaign, but don't have and don't want PayPal
give me a comment on top of the page or contact me directly :
vatula@hotmail.com
