story:
DISCOVER MILAN MUSEUMS THROUGH AN INTERACTIVE TREASURE HUNT!

We are Leonardo Da Vinci Film Society, a non-profit cultural association that has been organizing  the Milan International Film Festival Awards for 14 years, with the mission to encourage and support the progress of indie films from around the world.  

Our project EXPLORE-MI, designed for EXPO 2015, is a cultural initiative that consists in a  technological “treasure hunt” among Milan main museums. Participants will have fun hunting for challenging clues hidden in each museum, by using the event App created for smartphones and tablets, finding challenging clues hidden with qr code in each museum and solving them. The solution of each clue will lead to a series of subsequent puzzles and a new location!


                                                                   

 The aim? Find the right answer and win amazing prizes!

The event will last from May 2015 to October 2015.

There are 2 kinds of tickets available:

- 3-day ticket: the treasure hunt should be completed within a 3-day time;   

- 6-month ticket: there is no time limitation to complete the treasure hunt.

The event will be an opportunity for the participants to discover Milan artistic, cultural and scientific heritage. We invite participants to share emotions and knowledge under the sign of cultural entertainment and cross-cultural contamination.  

Our goal consists in promoting our city and its rich culture through an interactive itinerary that will involve both national and international participants. This will encourage cross-cultural encounters and exchanges!                       

Why should you join the event?

We would be grateful if you could support us: we need 10 000 € to start our project, by creating a website,  an app, qr code, a trademark and graphic communication.

Please, share our project to your friends on social media and Indiegogo!

We'll see you in Museum!

story:
Who is Honey Pot Performance?

Honey Pot Performance (HPP) is Artistic Co-Collaborators Felicia Holman, Aisha Jean-Baptiste, Abra Johnson and Artistic Director Meida McNeal, a quartet of Chicago-based, kindred creative spirits who have been working collaboratively on performances since January 2001.

Following in the footsteps of cultural workers such as Zora Neale Hurston, Beryl McBurnie, Pearl Primus and Katherine Dunham, Honey Pot Performance forefronts African diasporic performance traditions. We draw upon a central notion found in both performance studies and black feminist discourse: non-Western, everyday popular and/or folk forms of cultural performance are valuable sites of knowledge production and cultural capital for subjectivities that often exist outside of mainstream communities.

Juke Cry Hand Clap: Critical Performance + Public Humanities

Juke Cry Hand Clap marks a new outgrowth of dance theater work for HPP. We are investigating the cultural heritage, aesthetics, and material culture of Chicago house music and dance through a combination of live performance and public humanities programming. Honey Pot apply their collective experience in making performance, organizing conferences, workshops, and community dialogues drawing on a wide circle of relevant cultural workers. A skilled set of collaborators in set design (Norman Teague), sound design (Marlon Billups), graphic design (Ben Blount, Tandemfelix Letterpress), digital mapping (Lara Stein Pardo/Mapping Arts Project) and cultural history (Micah Salkind) help support the work to new depths of cultural and social praxis as well as production value.

Juke Cry Hand Clap focuses on house music culture as a conceptual ground to explore social practices developed in Black Chicago during the long 20th century. Drawing from music forms such as blues, gospel, disco, and funk as well as dances such as the slow drag, bopping, stepping, the hustle, and line dances, this work explores “house” as an evolving embodied lineage of African American forms of making community and of cultural resistance influenced by the Great Migration from the rural South to the urban North (1910s through the 1970s).

Critical Performance + Public Humanities Outputs:

*House & Chicago Social Culture Public Mapping Project (interactive website based on Mapping Arts platform)

*Special Journal Proceedings (from Feb 2014 Dance Music Evolution house symposium) in collaboration with designers Ben Blount and Tandem Felix Press

*Juke Cry Hand Clap Artist Book documenting HPP's creative process in collaboration with designers Ben Blount and Tandem Felix Press

*Realization of a site specific immersive performance space, a Juke Joint lovingly named The Honey Pot

*Public programming aligned with the fall premiere (workshops, community dialogues, curated artist/scholar talks in the site specific performance space)

*An exhibition of house music artifacts produced by our partner Modern Dance Music Archiving Foundation 

The Sweet Spot: Join the Honey Pot Hive as a Supporter!

As 2014 HCL Sponsored Artists, we were provided with rehearsal, performance, and event space plus marketing and design support. However, all support was 'in-kind' (meaning, "non-monetary") supported by Collaboraction theater company, the festival producer.  As we approach our October 2014 world premiere of Juke Cry Hand Clap, we are independently sourcing our production/marketing needs through various channels....which include THIS 45-day fundraising campaign!

What do we need from YOU?! 

Our goal for this 45-day fundraising campaign is to raise $7,500 for the urgent and varied production expenses of our 2014 HCL Sponsored Project, Juke Cry Hand Clap at Mana Contemporary Chicago (premiering October 3-5 & October 10-12, 2014). Your generous contributions will help cover the cost of the Juke Joint set, online map, publication projects, exhibition display, marketing, and production design needs (video/lights/costumes). Thanks to IndieGoGo's 'Flexible Funding' option, even if we don't meet our campaign goal, all "Stick With Honey Pot" contributions will go toward the costs listed above...but we know y'all wanna help us cross the finish line!!!

What do you get from US?!

With six contributor levels to choose from, your sweet "Stick With Honey Pot Performance" perk options include: published recognition of your contribution via social media and our marketing materials, a Juke Cry Hand Clap megamix by HPP collaborator DJ Jo de Presser, a peek inside our creative process during an open HPP rehearsal, "associate producer" credit, a private workshop, and at our highest giving level, contributors also receive a private catered event with a HPP performance. Let your budget & perk preference be your guide, y'all!

The HPP Impact

Between January and October 2014, Honey Pot Performance are artists-in-residence with High Concept Laboratories at Mana Contemporary (2233 S. Throop). In collaboration with cultural historian and house music scholar Micah Salkind and sound designer/DJ Jo De Presser, HPP is hosting a series of monthly public workshops. Various geographically disparate and intergenerational musical communities convene to dance, share memories, and map sites of musical and social development connecting the spaces of house music with those of its parent musical cultures (such as soul, r&b, gospel, blues and jazz).

Funding Juke Cry Hand Clap is important to us, our audiences and our communities because we each recognize that everyday popular and folk forms of cultural performance are valuable sites of knowledge production and cultural capital for subjectivities that often exist outside of mainstream communities. 

Performance is our therapy, our catharsis, our way to community. Performance is the haven that welcomes us to rediscover our own value and worth within a community that not only bears witness, but also empathizes through experience. It is in this spirit of healing & community that we strive to incorporate an authentic "househead" perspective in the canonization of Chicago house history & culture.

Since 2001, our creative works have been presented at Collaboraction (Chicago), Columbia College, the Chicago Cultural Center, Defibrillator (Chicago), High Concept Laboratories/Mana Contemporary Chicago, Museum Of Contemporary Art Chicago, Northwestern University, Malcolm X College (Chicago), Links Hall (Chicago), Old Town School of Folk Music (Chicago), the University of West Indies and Queens Hall(Trinidad), University of California-Riverside, and the Paragraph Gallery (Kansas City).  

We have also received grants and other generous support from the Center for Interdisciplinary Research in the Arts (Northwestern University), the Telecommunications Service of Trinidad & Tobago, the Community Arts Assistance Program, the Evanston Arts Council, the Illinois Humanities Council, the Contemporary Arts Council, Driehaus Foundation, Chicago Dancemakers Forum, Puffin Foundation and the University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill.

Join the Hive--Other Ways to Stick With Honey Pot!

Of course, we understand that some folks really want to but are unable to offer financial support.  No worries! There are several other ways to support Honey Pot Performance. You can ALWAYS....

*Share the "Stick with Honey Pot Performance" IndieGoGo campaign link.

*"Like"/Share the Honey Pot Performance Facebook page .

*Donate time to volunteer for HPP. Contact Felicia at honeypotperformance@gmail.com for more info.

*Attend Honey Pot Performance shows & bring folks!

*Join our HPP Review Crew---write & share your reviews of HPP shows.

Every bit helps and is MUCH appreciated! Please support independent and community-centered art.

Stick with Honey Pot Performance and spread the love!

Imagine a world of passion, desire, and erotic fantasy where you are the star!

Welcome to Adult Comic Press, a place where you can live your own dreams in the form of art.

With a subscription to our website and comic,s you can see our weekly updates with erotic content.

Order you own personal comics where you are the center of attention. You can live your fantasy with celebrities of your choice.

Want to suprise your special someone with a gift to remember....have a comic expertly drawn by our own comic artist with scenes and people of your choice.

all comic's will be full color,

story:
Hi, I am Buena Johnson, a professional visual artist based in Los Angeles  and it pains me to see that art has been taken out of most schools due to budget cuts. When we lose art, we lose our voice & a means of creative expression.  I know how vital art was to me as a child. Being introverted, I was able to express myself through art. Presently, my art is shown in museums & galleries & published in numerous books plus has traveled to the Smithsonian & around the world. I have conducted art workshops, demos & taught at major universities, schools & education facilities to all age levels-Children & Adults.

Art is a creative way to help children & all ages to develop. When the arts leave the schools, life leaves the schools. I plan to donate 500-1000 hours or more of my time to help the next generation. I want to give art back to the kids. My hope is to reach a diverse group of children from all backgrounds. I will travel to parks & schools and/or rent spaces to teach art and invest in our kids. The schools can't pay for art for the kids but (you) the community can. I need your support. Don't let our art die. Where there is art, there is life.

I am seeking funding for art supplies for the kids, equipment such as a canopy if needed, portable tables, projector, art tools, frame supplies & more, rental fees, travel, an assistant, snacks, promotional materials/flyers, printing & copying, research and more.

We know that visual art enriches a community. This enrichment comes with a price and the kids and I are counting on people like you to step forward to chip in. This Indiegogo campaign is a platform to generate funds no matter how big or small. Reaching our goal of $60,000 will aid in the life of this project and sustain my goal. To nurture this arts project is essential to our kids, our community and our future. We are turning to you, our strongest allies, to ask for help in realizing this goal. In  exchange for your support, as an artist I will generously provide incentives for your contribution. Please scroll down to see an example of some of the perks; *More perks may be added at Artist's discretion. Like & follow me at www.facebook.com/buenaartist to see your name posted.

Also, please help to get the word out and make some noise about this arts campaign. Please share with others who care about art for our kids & are willing to help by contributing.

PERKS: Contributions Campaign: FREE Art for Kids
1. Limited Edition of 300 Jazz Jam T-Shirts (available to first 300 contributors) at $100 & above perk level as indicated. *When the 300  L/E t-shirts are gone, you will receive a regular Jazz Jam T-Shirt.

The names of the legends is listed on the Jazz Jam T-Shirt under the picture image: Charlie Parker, Betty Carter, Jelly Roll Morton, Miles Davis, Bessie Smith, Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, Ella Fitzgerald, Louis Armstrong, Sidney Bechet, John Coltrane, Cab Calloway, Sarah Vaughan, Earl "Fatha" Hines, Dizzy Gillespie, Count Basie. And Signed by the Artist.

2. PERK: Dizzy or Charlie 17x23 Litho Available at the $100 & Above Contribution Level: The original art media is Pencil-hand drawn by fine artist BUENA.

Dizzy 'Bebop' Gillespie, 17x23"Litho-Signed

 Charlie 'Bird' Parker, 17x23" Litho-Signed

3. PERK: Signed 8 1/2x11 Lithograph images include:

      

    

The 8.5x11 Litho perks are available at the $25 & Above Contribution Level.

4. PERKS: Imagery for Handmade Art Greeting Cards will vary; All imagery is of high quality & superb standards. Limited Editions & Artist Proofs are Signed & Numbered with a Certificate of Authenticity: Imagery will be based on Artist's Artwork & quality of style as shown on website at http://buenaartist.com.

 *Personal Portrait commissions will be highly detailed in a flattering realism style.

Examples of some of my portrait styles: PERK at the $3500 to $10,000 & Above Contribution Level.

Commissioned Portrait of Actress Halle Berry by fine artist BUENA.


Thank you Everyone!

story:
Lama Tendron lives and works at a Tibetan Buddhist retreat center in the Santa Cruz Mountains of California.

She has completed two traditional Tibetan 3 year-3 month retreats. After many years of dedicated meditation and service to retreat lands, teachers, and communities in France and now here in California, it is now her time to be nourished through this auspicious pilgrimage.  We would love to make the pilgrimage a reality for her through this indiegogo campaign. This pilgrimage is part of the activities of www.Jnanasukha.org ; a foundation under the direction of Lama Dechen Yeshe Wangmo. 

A message of introduction from Neljorma Tendron

(Marie-Lauren Jacquet): I have spent most of my life in an immediate Dharma surrounding. It has been my good fortune to meet incredible teachers, Lamas, and Rinpoches and to walk in the steps of their practices and apply myself as much as I could for 34 years. I feel ready to visit again these holy places, which deliver the direct blessings of the Buddhas just by standing on the ground of the residence of Mahasiddhas.

In the biography of our feminine model of enlightenment, Yeshe Tsogyal, one thing that always fascinated me, is her moment of definitive release from her most intimate and subtle grasping of the world of illusion. No other biography describes it like that. I believe in the power of sacred places and with your help, I wish to go to Tsogyal Latso in September.  In addition, I am grateful for the opportunity to contribute to the support that the Jnanasukha organization is offering the nuns at Tsogyal Latso along with the preservation of this most important sacred site for the feminine in modern Buddhist lineages.   
Since 1990, I have been painting Buddhist images on white silk. This year, I was inspired to print those which I feel are the most beautiful pieces on metal plates. I really like how they turned out and would like to offer these as “perks” for sponsoring my pilgrimage to Tibet.

 Here is a message from Lama Yeshe Wangmo:

“Come, come, whoever you are. Wanderer, worshiper, lover of leaving. It doesn’t matter. Ours is not a caravan of despair. Come, even if you have broken your vows a thousand times. Come, yet again, come, come.” -Rumi

“This will be our fifth pilgrimage to the sacred sites of Khandro Yeshe Tsogyal, the Nyingma tradition, and the holy city of Lhasa. This year, the itinerary includes, for the first time, a three-day retreat at Tsogyal Latso, birthplace of Khandro Yeshe Tsogyal.   Although we travel as a group, your pilgrimage will be a personal journey as you discover your deeper connection to Dharma and new levels of understanding which only a pilgrimage can offer.

To me, as a lama, it's very important that Dharma not be limited to an intellectual understanding acquired from books and teachers. Dharma is a state of being. It is an experience. Experiencing the places where the greatest Mahasiddhas and philosophers have lived, where their energies and blessings still remain, awakens your karmic propensities and boosts you to a new level of faith and practice, much like receiving an initiation or empowerment.”

The preservation of these holy places tracing the life stories of the great yogis and yoginis of Tibet and their realization is important for our dharma activity and will benefit countless beings on their journey for centuries to come.

NeljormaTendron is offering some amazing “perks” including her beautiful unique art; making offerings of candles in your or your loved ones name at the holy places on the pilgrimage; Putting your or your loves ones name on the prayer list at Tsogyal Latso; and taking with her a spoon of ashes of a deceased loved one to be made into holy relics by the nuns Tsogyal Latso and deposited there in Tibet at the top of the world. In addition to these gestures Tendron has produced a number of amazing Metal plates of her most beautiful Tibetan Art.  Photos of these plates are in the gallery and are associated with the perks. Please take a look in the perks and through your funding donation indicate which art work you would like to receive. 

METAL PRINT DIMENSIONS:
SMALL Troma Nagmo: 7 inch high x 5 inch width.
SMALL Green Tara, Drolo and Vajrakilaya: 6 inch high x 5 inch width
MEDIUM Troma Nagmo: 12.3 inch high x 8 inch
MEDIUM Green Tara, Drolo and Vajarkilaya: 9.2 high x 8 width
LARGE Troma Nagmo :  30.2 high x 20 wide
LARGE Green Tara, Drolo and Vajarkilaya: 23 high x20 wide
Please check out the “perks” on this campaign and be inspired to participate in this beneficial activity of sending Neljorma Tendron to Tibet.

We want you to know where your funding will go so here is a list of expensed as well as an itinerary of the pilgrimage. 

 Trip expenses that we are fundraising for.

Pilgrimage Fee:

 Airfare: $1700
Tibet Trip Fee, permits, guide, gratuities and meals: $2000
Expenses in Chengdu: $300
Offerings in Tibet: $1,000

 We have set the campaign goal at $5,000 to take all these expenses into consideration.

Here is an Itinerary of the pilgrimage.  It is exciting to be able to follow the group’s activities with this outline. 

Itinerary At-A-Glance:

Length: 15 days in Tibet

Dates: August 25 - September 12, 2014

Day 1: Fly Chengdu-Lhasa, Mindrolling
Day 2: Lhasa, Barkhor Jokhang
Day 3: Lhasa, Potala, Lukhang
Day 4: Kangri Tokar
Day 5: Dorje Drak, Nup Sangye Yeshe, Zukhardo Stupas
Day 6: Samye
Day 7: Chimphu
Day 8: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 9: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 10: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 11: Drak Yong Dzong
Day 12: Kongpo Tso Dzong
Day 13: Tso Dzong, Bayi
Day 14: Buchu, Dudjom Lamaling
Day 15: Fly Nyangtri-Chengdu

Please view these wonderful perks offered as gratitude for your contributions to this campaign. If you are not able to contribute at this time please do share this campaign with the social share links available on this site. We are very grateful that you have taken the time to read this message. Wishing you all the very best in all your aspirations and adventures.

Please take a look in the perks and through your funding donation indicate which art work you would like to receive.  METAL PRINT DIMENSIONS:SMALL Troma Nagmo: 7 inch high x 5 inch width.SMALL Green Tara, Drolo and Vajrakilaya: 6 inch high x 5 inch widthMEDIUM Troma Nagmo: 12.3 inch high x 8 inchMEDIUM Green Tara, Drolo and Vajarkilaya: 9.2 high x 8 widthLARGE Troma Nagmo :  30.2 high x 20 wideLARGE Green Tara, Drolo and Vajarkilaya: 23 high x20 wide





Please check out the “perks” on this campaign and be inspired to
participate in this beneficial activity of sending Neljorma Tendron to Tibet. 
We want you to know where your funding will go so here
is a list of expensed as well as an itinerary of the pilgrimage.  
 Trip expenses that we are fundraising for. 
Pilgrimage Fee:
 Airfare: $1700Tibet Trip Fee, permits, guide, gratuities and meals: $2000Expenses in Chengdu: $300Offerings in Tibet: $1,000
 We have set the campaign goal
at $5,000 to take all these expenses into consideration.
Here is an Itinerary of the
pilgrimage.  It is exciting to be able to
follow the group’s activities with this outline.  
Itinerary At-A-Glance:
Length: 15 days in Tibet
Dates: August 25 - September 12, 2014
Day 1: Fly Chengdu-Lhasa,
Mindrolling
Day 2: Lhasa, Barkhor Jokhang
Day 3: Lhasa, Potala, Lukhang
Day 4: Kangri Tokar
Day 5: Dorje Drak, Nup Sangye Yeshe, Zukhardo Stupas
Day 6: Samye
Day 7: Chimphu
Day 8: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 9: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 10: Tsogyal Latso Retreat
Day 11: Drak Yong Dzong
Day 12: Kongpo Tso Dzong
Day 13: Tso Dzong, Bayi
Day 14: Buchu, Dudjom Lamaling
Day 15: Fly Nyangtri-ChengduPlease view these wonderful perks offered as gratitude for your contributions to this campaign. If you are not able to contribute at this time please do share this campaign with the social share links available on this site. We are very grateful that you have taken the time to read this message. Wishing you all the very best in all your aspirations and adventures.

story:
Meet the team who's #glamazing! 

Meet the Glamazon All Stars who spread the message of love, inclusion, family and equality; promoting society without prejudice or segregation. They spread this message by inviting anyone who shared these values to march and dance at Sydney's Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, in: 2010, 2012 and 2014. 

This coming year on March 7, 2015 - we invite YOU! And a very special guest, a world class artist who will feature some well-known hits - including a brand new single due for release in 2015!!

To give you a better idea about them, click here: The Glamazon All Stars

And here is our message:

Featuring the inestimable, Mary Kiani The GLAMAZON ALL STARS return to the stage for Mardi Gras Parade 2015 with their message of:

LOVE, INCLUSION, FAMILY, EQUALITY.  We want to invite YOU to help people realise that we should be living without prejudice, without segregation.

We've all been represented in the past by so many strong and powerful people from all walks of life and it's our duty to ensure that we keep spreading this message that we are all one, we are all family and united to share the love, we are all equal.

Now we invite you to take this opportunity to be a part of our message by offering a donation to help produce the parade entry that will proudly march up Oxford St on March 7, 2015 - join the conversation on:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/glamazonz

https://twitter.com/GlamAllStarz
Please follow us and send us your twitter handle so we can recognise you!

By spreading this campaign and donating, not only will you receive some great rewards, you will will be vital in sharing this message, and be a proud supporter of the Glamazon All Stars as they march and dance in the Mardi Gras parade in 2015.

Funds from this campaign will go towards production costs as listed below:

Costumes: $6,000

Vehicle Hire: $1,000 - includes tech crew

Vehicle Set Design: $2,000

Audio Visual: $6,000

AV contractor labour: $7,000

Media Team: $2,000

Total goal: $24,000
______________________________________________________

Donations of $25  and over receive gifts and performances.  
See below for terms and conditions. 

Reward Terms & Conditions:

*postage and packaging for sent items is included

*appearances by the Glamazons or Mary Kiani do not include travel or accommodation expenses

*All donators/supporters will be recognised in the credits of our official parade video which will be available to view on www.vimeo.com 2 weeks after the parade

*All rewards are redeemable by meeting us in person on parade day or by sending us your name and address to: GlamAllStarz@gmail.com

*Please bring/include a copy of your transaction ID for verification

* All rewards must be fully claimed by March 1, 2016

*This project is 100% non-for-profit

Other Ways You Can Help

Times can be tough, and if you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out, share this message and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can share this using the Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
Short Summary

Vancouver Island has an amazing graffiti community, although it lacks a sticker culture. In hosting this sticker, poster, and street art festival in Victoria, I hope to spark some interest in the community. 
This is the first of hopefully what turns into an annual sticker, poster, and street art exhibition on Vancouver Island. As interest in the event grows, so does our vision. This will be an all ages event during he day with a 19+ atmosphere in the evening with live music and more!
By bringing in some well established local talent such as CHI NO & Rizatek we hope to draw a crowd that may of once looked beyond the art on the walls, and have them engage in an interactive gallery, and meeting some of this city’s local talent.
We live in a world where we are required to seek out what interests us. We also live in a time where self promotion is prominent. It is the responsibility of the artist to bring the art to the people, and here at the Slap Happy Sticker, Poster & Street Art Expo, this is our ultimate goal!

***Unfortunately our partnering sponsor has moved locations and can no longer host the event.***
Due to these unfortunate circumstances we have been forced to seek out an alternative venue. Being that we still have 7 months until the show, we have decided to seek out a warehouse which will better suit our needs, allowing us little or no restrictions. There have been multiple promising locations recently visited, although without a Cash deposit we are living in a dream world. With your support we can help bring this dream world to reality.

UPDATE: 
We are happy to announce that our friends at OneSix Boardshop in Victoria BC have agreed to host a weekend long eventa The proposed plan includes some alterations to be done inside the shop, such as a temporary wall to divide the location into a store/gallery type setting which could operate indipendantly over the weekend.
A deposit of 50% is required to book the venue which is $600. Putting a deposit on this location is necessairy as soon as possible to prevent ending up in a situation with no venue once again.

What We Need & What You Get

The Break-Down

  • In addition to the venue fees mentioned above, the cost of building a temporary wall for the show with a secure entrance into OneSix Boardshop and removing it one week later is estimated at apx $1500.
  • The night portions of the event will be 19+ as we intend on getting a liquor license. This will be a paid event, weekend passes or single night passes will be available,
  • The daytime portion of the expo will be free and accessible to all to come down and interact with, check out the vendors, demos and a chance to win free night passes to the 19+ 

  • Sit in on blackbook sessions, get your hands on some free slaps and join in with our interactive "Slap-Mobile" where we invite visitors to cover it with slaps and tags!

  • Join in or watch the pros with our live painting sessions!

  • If our goal is not reached all of the raised funds will be contributed to the Slap Happy Sticker, Poster & Street Art Expo to better our facilities and promote the event! ...The show must go on!!

The Impact

  • In contributing to this campaign you are helping enrich the street culture of Vancouver Island, and its communities within. Providing artists with a platform to display their creative talents, by supporting this festival, you are assisting in bringing the artwork to the people.
  • By making a small contribution of $1 you are not only helping creative minds flourish, but you are contributing to the research and development supported by the Canadian Cancer Society as we will take 50% of these $1 donations and make a donation on behalf of the Slap Happy Sticker, Poster & Street Art Expo Supporters.  Thank you! 

Risks & Challenges

  • Planning this street art expo began as only a slight twinkle in my eye not much more than two months ago. Now, I sit fully submersed in the life of what I feel is a small enterprise. I have now come to the point where it is more than a one man job.

  • Oct 6th - This week I have teamed up with two other individuals who have committed to joining a Slap Happy Committee to help share some of the tasks at hand.

  • Oct 13th - This week we are happy to announce that a local vinyl cutter has offered their services free of charge to help promote the expo.
  • **UPDATE** Oct 29th - A large prize pack was donated to us by Jupiter Smoke Shop allowing us to sell raffle tickets to help bring in some revenue. The raffle date is December 10th 2014, hoping the money raised may be used as a venue deposit in January.
  • ***UPDATE*** Nov 29th -We are extreamly excited to announce that we have found a Venue for the show. A deposit must be paid ASAP to ensure we do not end up in a situation without a venue once again.  Ticket sales for the large prize pack are still under way, although they have slowed since the announcement of the draw. Multiple other items have been gifted to the expo to help generate revenue such as oil and acrylic paintings as well as a graphic novel, t-shirt and coffee maker. Any input on the best way to put these donations to use would be greatly appreciated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Although money makes magic happen, we are aware that not everyone has cash to donate. Help spread the word and share this expo!
  • Dont forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!!

story:
Extinction is forever, or is it?

Join us as we go to the faraway island of Rodrigues and explore how an almost-extinct ecosystem is being nursed back to life by substitute giant tortoises!

We—one wildlife artist, one sculptor, one photographer—will come together for a unique expedition to visually explore one of the world’s most exciting nature conservation projects, where extinct tortoises on one island are being replaced with survivors from another.

You can support this multidisciplinary art project by signing up for one or more amazing perks, ranging from expedition postcards & apparel to limited edition prints or original artworks!

NEW PERKS ADDED!

Get a set of A6-format (14.8 x 10.5 cm) postcards made by Rob, Anna-Maria, or Dennis for 25$ per set - or buy them all three!




Rodrigues is a small isolated island east of Madagascar. Humans arrived in the late 1600s and soon drove many of the island's species to extinction, including giant tortoises that lived in enormous herds. The forests were cut down, and the island was overgrazed by cattle and goats. The result: an ecological disaster zone.

                  


Recently, hope for a better future has returned for the ecosystem on Rodrigues. In the François Leguat Giant Tortoise and Cave Reserve, more than 150,000 seedlings of native plants have been planted, providing the heart of a new forest.

                  


In an amazing example of ecological de-extinction, giant Aldabra tortoises have been introduced to replace the extinct ones. Today, among the growing trees, these tortoises are the gardeners and engineers of the new forest. Their actions help create a dynamic, self-sustaining forest.

Many questions arise: Can an almost-extinct ecosystem be resurrected? How do the replacement giant tortoises live their lives? Are there any ecological or evolutionary traces left of the ghosts?


In summer 2014, we will explore these questions in the François Leguat Reserve, in the Expedition to de-Extinction. Together, during several weeks, we plan to sketch, sculpt, paint, and photograph our way through the resurrected ecosystem of Rodrigues from three complementary artistic angles, in a visual exploration of one of the world’s most exciting nature conservation projects. 

We will focus on capturing the essence of the ghosts of the extinct giant tortoises and how the giant Aldabra tortoises are returning life to the ecosystems of Rodrigues

We envision that our three visual interpretations created during and immediately after the expedition will lead three synergistic lives:

1) A joint exhibition in Zurich, Switzerland; 2) An installation at the François Leguat Reserve, plus limited edition works sold to support the Reserve; and 3) A richly illustrated book about the expedition.



Robin Wingrave

Anna-Maria Bauer

Dennis Hansen


We offer a broad range of perks in return for your support of the expedition. The first three perks offer a mixture of follow-up emails/postcards/t-shirts - all produced to the highest standards (if you're lucky, we might just add small original drawings and sketches on the back of the postcards!).



Shelling out (sorry, we couldn't resist using that pun at least once) on higher-level perks will get you exclusive limited editions of printed artwork, produced on heavy cotton paper with museum-quality inks. There are two main types: pre-expedition, and expedition artwork.
 
The pre-expedition pieces are for people who wish to get an exclusive piece of art sooner rather than later. The expedition pieces are for people who are curious and with enough patience to wait until after the expedition has run its course next summer.

IMPORTANT!! If you are ordering one of the perks that require postage & packing (prints/originals), please add the following amounts to your pledge:

Shipping of Robin's artwork: 10 USD (Australia), 15 USD (rest of the world)
Shipping of Anna-Maria's or Dennis' artwork: 10 USD (Europe), 15 USD (rest of the world).

Pre-expedition perks: Limited editions

Robin is working full steam ahead on a watercolour painting of an Echidna, the closest thing in Tasmania to a tortoise (perhaps apart from a wombat, but the echidna has defensive spines that are ecologically equivalent to the shell of a tortoise. Or something). Rumour has it that Rob plans to add a second echidna to the painting, plus ants! (for the myrmeocophiles among us).


Anna-Maria has just finished the proto-type of the Chine-collé print of a brand-new artwork, which serves as the perfect entry-piece into her enormous body of work: She first traced the outline of, and the lines on, the belly surface of a turtle, and then thickened the lines where the parts of the shell come together. Pieces and bits of this matrix of intersecting lines were then strewn underneath, like morphological leaves dropped to the ground, ready to be (re-)assembled or used elsewhere.  (heavy cotton rag paper; size of paper 15 x 21 cm, embossed print 11.5 x 16 cm).


Dennis is preparing a black & white photo from the eastern part of Aldabra Atoll, where the density of giant tortoises is so high that their grazing creates many tightly-cropped grass patches. Resembling a line of helmets, the tortoises move and mow across the turf. The photo will be printed with pigment inks on heavy cotton rag paper; Dennis is experimenting with various sizes of print and paper, and the final dimensions will be determined soon.



Our top-perks are original artworks that will be created during the expedition! 

Please refer to the complete list of perks on the right-hand side; ask us if there is anything else you'd like to see up there - and we might just make it available.


Contribute/obtain a perk for 100 USD or more, and your name will be featured on a donors' plaque at the exhibition, as well as in the acknowledgements in the book!



What will we spend the money on? 

  •   $7500: Travel costs (1x from Australia, 2x from Switzerland to Rodrigues)
  •   $1800: Accommodation on Rodrigues (shared house near the reserve)
  •   $3500: Materials (art & printing paper, canvases, paint, metal, silicon and plaster cast material)
  •   $1500: Shipping of materials to Rodrigues and shipping of resulting studies/artwork to Switzerland.
  •   $580: Indiegogo fees

What will happen next?

Be sure to check in regularly, as we will be adding to the campaign page regularly - and follow us on facebook for more updates and the latest news!

I have no money, what can I do to help you?

No matter if you are a fellow tortoise- and/or island fanatic, or have a burning interest in learning more about the new forest ecosystem on Rodrigues, we can use all the help we can get! Remember that rich uncle of yours in the USA? -your partner's win in the lottery? Now is the perfect time to tell them about our project and get them excited about it! Alternatively, spread the word to your social network via all the usual (plus unusual) channels!

We cannot make our expedition happen without your support; a massive THANK YOU to anyone who contributes or supports us in any other way!!

story:
DEE LEE DOO is a unique blend of inner curiosity, desire and inspiration from nature. As a woman and professional wood designer I wanted to explore and create an intimate toy that was honest, aesthetically refined and above all natural.

When designing a sex toy, materials are an essential ingredient. Wood, along with all of its unique qualities was an obvious choice. With proper woodwork and a delicate finish it turns into an all natural sex toy, which will last you a lifetime. 

I aspire not only to design elegant, all natural sex toys but also to make them into distinct, artistic and personable bedroom accessories. I want to destigmatize and turn them into objects, which can be displayed as well as enjoyed. Sensual, erotic and natural. 



Woodwork design is a delicate craft. Production can be quite demanding and requires a lot of focus. My designs are plotted with precision, formed by hand and require multiple stages of careful sanding. Each piece and all of its details are finished by hand in my workshop.


Dee Lee Doo wooden toys are made of all-natural plantation wood. I carefully selected a variety of three local and three exotic wood types for you to chose from. Pick the one that suits you best.



As soon as I've reached the desired shape, each Dee Lee Doo dildo is finished with multiple layers of all-natural, environmentally-friendly, water thinned transparent varnish, free of solvents and wood preservatives, with a consistent selection of ecologically friendly raw materials. The process emphasises the wood color and structure but also forms a very thin layer, which protects the wood from damage, makes it waterproof and ensures long lasting quality of the dildo.


Each Dee Lee Doo sculpture embodies solid organic curves and thought-out ergonomic qualities. During the design process, I let my intuition guide me. You should certainly do the same when choosing one. Dimensions are guide only, size of each piece may vary slightly.

Dimensions: 5.5 x 1.2 in / 14.5 x 3 cm

A mini version of a Dee Lee Doo dildo.


Dimensions: 9.5 x 1.2 in / 24 x 3.5 cm

The first Dee Lee Doo design, which provoked the entire collection. Very simple, elegant, and the longest of them all. 


Dimensions: 8.3 x 1.6 in / 21 x 4 cm

The most realistic of my designs, particularly in terms of use and feel. It is narrow in the middle for a better grip. 




Dimensions: 9 x 1.6 in / 23 x 4 cm

This design is most in line with nature. It is smooth but a little unpredictable. 




Dimensions: 7.8 x 1.2 in / 20 x 3.5 cm

One of the straighter dildos I've designed. Its varying width creates a very stimulating double wave effect. 



Dimensions: 7.9 x 1.2 in / 21 x 3.5 cm

Beautiful organic design, open to sensual and imaginative use. Easy to handle and guaranteed to please.


Dimensions: 9 x 1.6 in / 23 x 4 cm

The most dynamic design in my collection, very pleasant to use. This one is very easy to handle due to its shape and extended tail, which makes it a great Christmas gift for women as well as men.


A dominant piece in my collection and the most popular bedroom toy besides the dildo. Beautiful ergonomic handle and eco-friendly faux leather falls. 




The dildos will be packaged in a locally sown satchel made of soft, all-natural wool. The finished product will also be protected with a carton tube and sent to your address, without revealing the contents of the package.


I've finish my studies and moving on onto the next stage in life. I've found my passion and am determined to pursue it. On top of this, I firmly believe in local, sustainable production and no compromises. With your support I'll be able to equip my shop with the necessary tools to continue my work efficiently, develop new dildo designs, explore new ideas and ensure use of only the best quality, natural and environmentally friendly raw materials. And of course, deliver your rewards on time :)







I designed Dee Lee Doo dildos to be completely hygienic, non-allergenic and DIN certified safe to use. The surface finish is solid, smooth, water-safe and allows for easy and effective cleaning. The quality of the coating and the wood itself are of the highest standard and crafted with utmost precision, hence will not splinter or cause damage to skin if used without applying excessive force. After use, simply rinse the dildo with water and dry it off. With good care and proper maintenance wood can last forever. 

Despite full confidence in the safety of my designs, please use the dildos responsibly and at your own risk. 




Special thanks to my boyfriend Kásás Mihajlo, who works hard in the workshop and cooks really well. Many thanks to my dear friends and colleagues who have helped me with the campaign:  Video: Kristian Predanic , Taras Ungar , Matej Zavernik  / Web: Lunin.si  / Photo: Ramaida Osim (product shots), Ada Hamza (art shots) / branding : The Miha Artnak  / business advisory: Jan Vranjek / PR: Tea Dežman, Nadja Ocepek / Legal: Maja Jancic Bogataj / Crowdfunding advisory: Luka & Piskoric Crowdfunding.si community

story:
Guten Tag

Help us fuel young international artists who want to study with some of the most stunning contemporary artists at AUTOCENTER Summer Academy (ACSA 2014) in Berlin! As a non-profit exhibition center in Berlin, we need support from you guys who are as passionate about contemporary art as we are.

  • ACSA 2014 is a four-week program, that connects international experts drawn from all fields of the arts with artists and students for weeklong courses of adventure, study, and making in Berlin. 
  • Participants will have the opportunity to develop their artistic practice and theory in interchange and interaction with their teacher –while at the same time immersing themselves in one of the most exciting city art scenes in the world. Courses culminate each Saturday evening with public presentations held at AUTOCENTER.

Where You Come In 

We wish our program were free, but unfortunately there are critical expenses and we have not been able to receive governmental funding this year. With this campaign we aim to significantly lower the tuition of ACSA 2014 for ALL participants. 

Spread the word, raise awareness, and support the unique, artistically and intellectually adventurous spirit of ACSA 2014 in Berlin.


Scroll to see a snippet of what happened at ACSA last year: 

Students gathering with artist Ned Vena for some outdoors adventure. 

Student work on paper. 

Student Installation. 

Class time. 


Our ultimate goal is to raise: 31,200€ (crucial reduction of tuition for all participants) 

10€ = Hero Status 

20€ = Hero Status + Invitation to ACSA Exclusive Party

50€ = Hero Status + ACSA Exclusive Party + Huge Brand New Autocenter Catalog 

150€ = Hero Status + ACSA Exclusive Party +  Huge Brand New Autocenter Catalog + Annual Membership to Friends of Autocenter

500€ = Hero Status + Invitation to ACSA Exclusive Party + Huge Brand New Autocenter Catalog + Annual Membership to Friends of Autocenter + Piece of selected original artwork created during ACSA 2014

*** Please note that all swag must be picked up from AUTOCENTER Berlin headquarters, we can’t wait to see you here!) ***

Even if you can't contribute financially we still need your help! Share our campaign link through email and all social media platforms. Please stop by Autocenter at anytime, we would love to have you here. 


Any Questions? Email us at: office@autocenter-summeracademy.de

story:
ABOUT ENDLESS EDITIONS

Endless began as a collaborative group exhibition in the summer of 2012, Endless Editions is the most current manifestation of this idea. We premiered this project in January of 2014 in an open call group show at Con Artist Collective.

We are a publishing project which editions and disseminates books and prints by artists irrespective of their background, career, gender, sexuality, age or work experience. 

During our first year, Endless Editions works have shown at Court Tree Collective, Mixed Greens Gallery, Printed Matter, Inc., Art Metropole, The Sculpture Center via Desert Island Comics, McNally Jackson and the New York Art Book Fair at MoMA PS1. Endless Editions books are catalogued at the Newark and New York Public Libraries. With six editioned titles, and an open-submission monthly periodical, Endless highlights the artist who we believe deserve recognition.

Endless uses Riso printing technology, a digital duplication format invented in Japan in 1986. Riso printing is an effective way of producing high volumes of prints or books. The images are similar to that of screenprinting with the efficeincy of a xerox printer. It is the perfect combination of digital and handmade printing. Riso's soy based ink and energy standards make Riso printing a clean and energy-efficient printing method.

CALL TO ACTION

Since its inception, Endless Editions has been funded by the personal investments of its founders. Beginning with the purchasing of a single Riso printer, Endless has since acquired several Riso and inkjet printers. Our mission is to make publishing more accessible to artists, meaning that costs related to publishing are covered by us. We wish to alleviate economic burden from artists and are asking you for support. This fundraiser will help Endless Editions to establish a budget for 2015 for the sake of producing and showcasing artworks.

2015 EDITIONS

In the next year we plan on producing several editions by artists such as Glen Baldridge and Kharis Kennedy among many others. But first we will be producing an abecedarian in two parts by Ashley May. The source material for these two books, "A-M" and "N-Z", is a GIF animation created by the artists. This GIF depicts a selection from her postcard collection, endlessly repeating in a circular motion. We have already begun the proofing process with Ashley May, and have decided that the book will not only display the animation, but will physically recreate the animation. We wish to produce an interactive book object.

      

Each book will contain 23 pages which read linearly, as a typical book does, displaying pictorial representations of letters A-M and N-Z. Each page will hinge to the page which precedes it with a custom tab, allowing the book to fan outward into a circular book object. Two distinct images are created based on how we have oriented the rotation of pages, and so this book will be produced in two versions. We are looking to raise funds for this project to build custom archival boxes for these book objects to live in.

ENDLESS AUDIO

Endless will be expanding the scope of our publishing practices by introducing multi-media works into our catalogue. Our first project will feature the group Intra Faction. With this group, we will be producing a media package within a custom USB drive attached to an art book. The drive will contain a brand new record release by the band, a music video containing footage from a secret show and photos. Endless Audio hopes to promote sonic works which may be overlooked by traditional record labels and music venues. Donations made to this fundraiser will offset the cost of creating customized items for this innovative release.

BOOK FAIRS AND EXHIBITIONS

We will be taking our editions with us to the Los Angeles Art Book Fair in January of next year. This will be our first appearance at the LA installment of this fair. We will potentially be traveling to Europe in May for a book fair in France. In both cases, we hope to find new audiences for our artists' work. Support will allow us subsidized travel expenses as that we can continue to promote our works.

Next year, we will also be potentially occupying a space in the NY/NJ area. If this happens, we will be creating our dream bookmaking shop, complete with a community bookstore and gallery space. We are asking for your support in helping us raise a budget for this community project.

SPRTS

We plan to continue producing SPRTS, our monthly periodical, next year. What began as a satirical, faux-editorial regarding the world of professional sports, has quickly turned into a platform for artists to share ideas. At this time, we sell enough copies of SPRTS each month to produce the next issue. Funding for this project will allow us to continue to make this magazine more sophisticated and bring its service to more artists.

BUDGET

We are looking to raise $20,000 during this fundraiser

$6,000 - Can produce one year of SPRTS, leaving us with a larger budget for artist editions.

$4,000 - For the production of Ashley May's "A-M" and "N-Z" and materials for general publishing next year.

$3,300 - For replacement Riso Parts. This will also offset the cost of our purchasing an MZ 790 printer, which allows us to print at full tabloid size. Can't have beautiful books without healthy machines.

$2,650 - Materials for our potential studio/gallery, and for exhibition purposes.

$1,800 - x2 new Color-Drums for the Riso MZ 790. This will allow us to produce 4-color impressions at full tabloid size.

$1,500 - Travel. This will subsidize our travel to and from Los Angeles and cover some shipping costs.

$750 - Table at the Los Angeles Art Book Fair.

REWARDS

When donating to this fundraiser, you can receive Endless Editions publications.

The editions which are available as rewards are...

Hamburger Vampire Funny Money by Zebadiah Keneally. 3-color Riso print. Ed. of 600. 

The Classic "Thank You//Fuck You" Bag

You can receive one, or buy a subscription to SPRTS


For the drama-historian in you, pickup Phil Sanders' "The Widow Bull," a devotion to Elizabethan dramatist Christopher Marlowe. 


Get a beautifully hand-bound photo-riso book "Casting Shadows Revealing Light" by Staphanie Land. Architectural forms bordering on abstraction.


Help us fundraise for Ashley May's "A-M" and "N-Z" be the first to get a SUPER limited edition, 24" x 30" Inkjet print (1/6) signed by the Artist. Inspired by her project. A framed version is also available.

Or pickup an Ashley May Riso print.


Receive the OG Endless Edition. Hamburger Vampire's "Lunch Is Very Important: All The Secrets To Life You Never Knew You Knew" by Zebadiah Keneally.


Get the Newest Audrey Ryan zine "This Is Not For You"



Get a duotone Riso print signed by the founders of Endless Editions featuring the 14th Congressional district of NY.

Find all of these rewards and more on the side of this page. Many of these prints come in various package deals. 
Your support will directly help us to produce more work by talented artists, and to bring this work to a larger audience in 2015.
For More Information Visit 
www.endlesseditions.com

story:
Our Story

Dolls House is comprised of six girls, currently in their second year at Nottingham Trent University studying Fine Art. We came together through similar interests and now want to create an installation based exhibition in Nottingham's city centre from the 18th October 2011. 

 

We have found the perfect location; the basement of a furniture store, which also holds an entrance to Nottingham's system of caves. We are transforming the space which already has some elements of a house into a representation of a doll's house, it'll essentially be a life-sized doll's house and our work will reside within it. We're all really excited about it but to make it a reality we could do with some help, and you guessed it... because we're students we don't qualify for any Arts Council Grants or support!!


The Impact

We are really hoping to encourage those who don't usually get involved in art to participate in our events, this will be by placing the work in a non-gallery space. We just want to get people involved and enjoying art like we do :)

What We Need & What You Get

In order to secure this great location, we need £500, which is just over $800. Every cent donated will go towards paying the rent for the rooms. We are trying to raise money ourselves through organised events, which we hope will help to finance the private view, as well as any costumes and props needed.


Everyone who donates will receive an art work inspired by the exhibition and a personal invitation to the private view.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although we will be advertising the exhibition nearer to the opening, we still need you to spread the word about the exhibition and of course come and visit it! We also have a facebook page where you can create your own dolls and join in the fun.

story:
Fire Art

Hi, my name is Krueger and I am a fire artist.  In 2010, I created a fire scupture entitled "Burning Gothic."  Inspired by artist Grant Wood's "American Gothic" painting, I wanted to recreate it with my preferred medium, fire.  It is a flaming pitchfork and photo where people can become part of the fire art painting and get thier pictures taken.

Now, I would like to create my second fire scultpure which I shall call "Fire Art."  The sculpture will spell out the title of the piece written in engulfed flames.  There would also be a secondary flame effect known as a poofer attached to this piece for added effect.

The motivation behind "Fire Art" is to educate and elighten people.  I would like to use this piece to teach people how to construct a fire sculpture; bringing the world of fire and art together is simple and beautiful way.  I want to illistrate that fire can be fun, safe art.  This project will be NFPA 1160 compliant.

I need money to purchase parts and propane.

Estimated total cost of this project is $800.00.  I have recived a grant from Bold Urban Renanssance Network NFP (www.boldurban.org) for $350.00.

I am asking you for your assitance to help me finish funding the remaining parts of my sculpture.  I will need to purchase more complex parts and propane that is the major consumbables required in the creating this sculpture.  No tools or labor costs have been attibuted in the over all budget.  If I don't make my funding goals, I am going to piece meal this sculpture together with what I can, when I can, and finish it at a later time.

Contributors 

First and foremost, contributors will recived me eternal gratitadue.  More specifically:

  • $25.00: Donors will receive a photograph of the finished fire sculpture at it's first public appearance, Lakes of Fire 2012.
  • $50.00:  Donors will "make their mark" on the sculpture.  Donors at this level will be added to a special donor plaque on the platform of the sculpture. 
  • $100 or more:  Special donors who contribute $100 or more will receive an invitation to an exclusive donor five-course dinner hosted and prepared by mysel for you and a guest.  As an added bonus, you will be able to chose one of the courses!


I would like to have this peice completed for Lakes of Fire, an art and fire festival at the end of June.  This project is going to be a way for me to gift education and art to the community and illistrate what can be done with fire. I hope that it will inspire more people to think outside the proverbial box and create their world.

Please, even if you have no funds to give, do something, and spread to word, share the love and share this campaing.

 

Thank you,

Krueger

story:
OVER! 

Final talley is 11,730 (unless ghosts again). Welp, you've totally blown me away guys I couldn't be happier with this project and the support. There still a lot of work done so i'll be updating you guys and keeping you abreast!

Thank you so very much!

8k Hit mous pads for everyone! (who is receiving a calendar) - 10k

I’ve added the $10 000 milestone

You will receive 1 Mouse pad, you may chose the cover art or any of the art produced for the calendar. Available for all calendar receivers.

$100 Pay bump for all the artist.

Digital realease of sexier versions of Doxy's contributions

 

New Support Level Special Edition + 8k Funding Goal

A special edition option is now available. Special editions will have a seperate cover and most likely have foil stamping. These copies will be signed by me. Please follow "upgrade" procedures. If you have already supported you do not select this option but simply make up the difference and fill out this form  http://bit.ly/Ul8EZA

Added $15 reward level if you want to add your name to the credit list but only wanted a digital version.

8k Funding goal will open up Mouspads since it seemed to be well liked by most of the all access members. 

>> UPGRADING SUPPORT LEVEL << 

If you want to increase you contribution level you must contribute the difference then fill this form >> http://bit.ly/Ul8EZA << This is a bit messy but the only way to do it. Please make sure you are making up the difference and have a clear support level reward you wish to reach.

WE DID IT! PROJECT FUNDED AT 6K!

Thanks so much guys!

We are doing 12 pages!

6 by me as before 6 more by participating artists.

>>> UPDATE <<<

I've dropped the milestone to 6000 for the 12 page multi artist version

Artists involved if we hit the 6k milestone are >>

Sheperd0821 
Miu
Jay Axer
X-Arielle
ManiacPaint
Yano

Doxy's Little Calendar

My Deviant Art

This Calendar will be SFW. No different then a Sport Illustrated Swimsuit Edition

Doxy's Little Calendar is a fan created calendar featuring sexy human ladies of equestrian origin. The initial calendar will have 6 pages, 2 months per page. A 12 page calendar will be made if we hit the $6500 milestone. 

The goal is to have the book shipped to all supporters for christmas.

This project will update regularly with news and content\artist's involved so keep watching! I have no idea how  this product will be sold or distributed outside of this project so if you want this calendar get it now!

 

Milestones

$6 000 
12 pages instead of 6. Extra pages may be done by other artists depending on deadlines. Sexy versions of the calendar featuring tasteful nudes of the origianl works released digitally.

$8 000
You will receive 1 Mouse pad made from the calendars cover art. Available for all calendar receivers.

$10 000
You will receive 1 Mouse pad, you may chose the cover art or any of the art produced for the calendar. Available for all calendar receivers.

50$ Paybump for the contributing artists.

Sexy versions of Doxy's contribution released digitally.

 

Q & A

Q. How did you come to the price?

A. I had to average out demand and estimate numbers but here's the break down.

Printing Fees

500 copies X $5 a copy is about average for that volume.

We are looking anywhere between $5 to $15 depending on the company and services provided. Lulu charges 15$ per copy just to get an idea of how expensive things can get.

So $2500 is a conservative though slightly risky estimate.

Delivery fees

The delivery of the product from the printer to either myself or another company that will ship it will be around $150-$500 depending if it's overseas or not. I'm not 100% sure right now it's point of origin so this number has to be a bit loose.

Shipping & Handling Fees

The worst sin to commit I've seen for any crowdsourced project is to neglect the cost of shipping to supporters. I've settled on $10 as a safe number for both North american and european sales. Though any addtional shipping fees that surpass $10 by any noticeable ammount will be requested from the supporter. This fee covers both shipping and handling, handling represents time spent sorting, packaging, travel and all other time spent shipping the product. The project needs about 100 - 200 supporters to hit the project first milestone so about $1500 for Shipping & Handling.

Final Cost

$2500 + ~$300 +  $1000 = $3800

+$700 Safety net

For Administration, digital assembly, advertising, project coordination, drawing, hiring artists, print proof costs and etc.

Final Total = $4500

 

Q. Why are you using Indiegogo instead of Kickstarter. 

A. Kickstarter is for Americans only

 

Q. When will I receive the digital edition

A. As soon as the books are printed and start being shipped to supporters the digital edition will be sent

 

Q. Will you be selling this calendar outside of this project.

A. I don't know but I wouldn't bank on it. If you want a copy this is the best time to get it. Bast december the value of a calendar plummets so it's best to get everyone on board now. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet, Reblog, Share, Link, the indigogo share tools can help out with this!

 

Support Levels 

 Digital Copy 
  High Resolution Digital Edition
  Widescreen Formatted Wallpaper Edition
 
 Digital Copy - Artist Edition
  DIGITAL COPY
  Stream Recordings
  Layered PSD\SAI Files
  Calendar + Special Print \ Supporter credits
 
 Physical Copy  - Shipped
  DIGITAL COPY
  Calendar + Special Print \ Supporter credits
 
 Physical Copy  Artist Edition - Shipped
  DIGITAL COPY - ARTIST EDITION
  Calendar + Special Print \ Supporter credits
 
 All Access - Shipped
  DIGITAL COPY - ARTIST EDITION
  Calendar + Special Print \ Supporter credits
  Access to Development Blog Featuring
  · Sketches and Designs uploaded daily
  · Stream reminders 1 hour prior to starting
  · Comments & Feedback

story:
BUY THE BOOK at www.wemakestuff.tumblr.com


WE DID IT!

---------------

 WeMakeStuff Volume 01

WeMakeStuff Volume 01 is a stunning book that will showcase one hundred artists and innovators from Vancouver exploring the collision of faith and creativity. It will be a historical document showcasing creative people expressing their process, intent and the tensions of their reality.

The one hundred are artists, innovators, inventors, engineers, architects, designers, film-makers, dancers, programmers, entrepreneurs, chefs and writers. For the first time, their collective voices are being recorded in one ground-breaking publication.

You Make it a Reality

As a fellow artist and innovator, or friend and fan, you understand there's a need for people of faith to realign with their creative history and calling.

Here's how you make what we make a reality:

Contribute toward our goal of raising $35,000 to print the first run of WeMakeStuff Volume 01. In return, you have the option to receive:

  • The stunning softcover edition of the book – 256 pages, 9”w x 9”h full-color book printed at Hemlock Printing on the highest quality, 100% post-consumer, FSC certified recycled paper. This publication is a piece of art in itself.
  • An eBook version for your favorite tablet device
  • A limited hardcover collector’s edition with linen-case cover
  • Limited edition t-shirts
  • An exclusive WeMakeStuff video produced by DavidVandas.com featuring creativity in your organization

Dollars and Cents

  • $35,000 is needed to cover the costs of a minimum print run of 1000 softcover editions  and 250 limited edition hardcover copies.
  • Money raised above our minimum goal will go toward additional print runs and reimbursing the team that has been investing literally thousands of hours to produce an exceptional product. $100,000 is what it would take to actually break even.
  • If we don't meet our minimum goal, you get your money back and the project never sees the light of day. But we both know that isn't going to happen – not if you have any say in the matter.

Who's in Book?

Here's a sampling (check out the full list here):

  • Stephen Duff - Designer of a 4.5 million tall-ship for SALTS in Victoria; Instructor at Emily Carr Institute for Design
  • Chris van Dyck - VFX Artist on The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, Tron: Legacy, Transformers: Dark of the Moon,
  • Steve Mitchinson - Medical doctor producing music for people facing death
  • Tara Teng - Miss World Canada with a creative approach to oppose human trafficking
  • Trevor Hoffmann - Protege composer and pianist
  • Vern Giammartino - Creative Director/motion graphics for clients such as Discovery Channel, Warner Brothers and Telus TV
  • Brian Doerksen - Juno-award winning musician
  • Stephanie Limage - Visual artist gifting her creativity to orphans in Haiti
  • Ezra Kwizera - Rwandan orphan, now hip hop artist
  • Corwin Hiebert - Author and creative talent manager
  • Michal Tkachenko - Visual artist tackling modern day celebrity and sainthood

WeMakeStuff aims to create a safe place for dialogue and discovery. We can't wait to introduce you to these incredible individuals who are bravely speaking into our culture. You may be surprised by what you have in common with them.

Check out the Gallery to see some sample spreads from the book. For a taste of the type of content included in the book check out our Facebook page where we are featuring a different artist every day.

Selection Process

The 100 artists for WeMakeStuff Volume 01 were selected by these 16 people.

  • Ali Cumming - Regent College - Arts Administrator
  • Darlene Ketchum - Pacific Life Bible College - Director of Music and Arts
  • David Squires -Trinity Western University - Dean of the School of the Arts, Media + Culture
  • Sandy & Russ Rosen - Dance Barn Studio - Director, Russ Rosen Band
  • Joycelin Ng - Vancouver Arts Network - Director
  • Ron Reed - Pacific Theatre - Founding Artistic Director
  • David Vandas - Vandas Creative - Director
  • Garnet Campbell - Red Ant Digital Push - Director
  • Marika Siewert - Emerton Records - Founder
  • Nelson Boschman - Artisan Church - Pastor
  • Deb Sears - Reel Light & Missions Fest Vancouver Film Festival - Director
  • Naomi Lippett - WaterShed Arts Cafe - Curator
  • Anna Vandas - Vandas Creative - Director
  • Jill Marie Bronson - Squamish Whistler Community
  • Judy Osiowy - Wallflowers and Beyond - Owner/Curator
  • Daniel Sicolo - Emdee Creative - Creative Director

Add Your Voice

If this project excites you, help us spread the word. Follow the links below to follow and share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Don't be shy about sharing this project with your friends and colleagues offline as well!
